Reviews.Title: “Good location and a reputable hotel”
Reviews.Author: JiannW
Reviews.Content: I've been more or less a regular at the Holiday Inn in Darling Harbour Sydney and I have yet to come across any problems with them, except that sometimes during peak hours, you will have to wait awhile before you would be able to check in due to the queue. Whilst I would not say the location is ideal, it is indeed good. Within walking distance to Darling Harbour and located just behind Chinatown, and opposite the Darling Harbour Arena, it is indeed a pretty good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay, good location”
Reviews.Author: Alan056
Reviews.Content: Great location with Darling Harbour, Conference centre, Chinatown,, Markets, Main bus and rail stations all within a 10 minute walk. Main shopping areas and Circular Quay, Harbour Bridge can be reached within 25mins walk as well. Room was typical Holiday Inn, situated on 6th floor,clean with basic furnishings, great beds, large shower area. Fridge was a bonus. Stayed 4 nights on PC Rewards, didn't use the restaurant or bar as plentiful choice in surrounding area. All staff were attentive and helpful with directions and advice. Hotel appeared popular with trips from many nationalities. Would definately stay here again and would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A Hotel in Busy Chinatown.”
Reviews.Author: Funtravel712 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Australia Tour Stayed here April 1 and 2, 2012 Location: This hotel got a really nice location. Shops all around, a monorail that runs in front of the hotel with station a few steps away, a McDonald fast food diagonally left front of the hotel, and a bargaining market called Paddy's Market at the leftmost side. Back side of hotel are restaurants and shops. Also near the main street where you can walk 3 to 4 blocks to reach a Woolworth supermarket. All I can say its a very convenient location specially with the monorail that can bring you places. HOTEL: Lobby: Its not very grand and not very small either. Quite functional. Breakfast area is small and most of the time full but turn around time is quick. Did not encounter any problem so far. Room: We are placed at 3rd floor where the Gym is located. I guess this is because we traveled by Tour Group therefore room rates are cheaper thus effect is the whole Tour Group of 25 pax is to be placed at lower floor. The room doors... As I walk down the hallway to our room, I find the doors to be quit old already. This already gave me the impression that the hotel had not been refurbished yet and is due for one. As I entered the room, it had the usual layout. Hallway with Bathroom on the right side then 2 twin bed then a TV table with a small picture tube TV set (if not mistaken, its a 21" or below in size) then a table and chair and the curtained window. Outside the window, view is a wall and another house. A cabinet to put cloths. Inside is a safe, iron and ironing board. What I do not like with the room is despite the lighting that is available, I feel that its still very dim. It would be nice if it would have been much brighter even just a little bit more. Bathroom: It is okay and quite big but the paint color of its wall is dull and boring, which gives the impression (in my opinion) of an old and aged hotel. But I was happy on the curved curtain rod on the bath area because it includes the ceiling light to be in the bathtub area. This is nice because it illuminates the bath area properly. Also a plus for my mom who is a senior already. Service: The reception area people and bell boy knows the basic rule "Smile and Greet". However the people in the breakfast area do not even smile. They look like they are forcefully working there. Verdict: Its an aged 4 star hotel with a very good location. Food. Shopping. All within walking distance. All within reach. If you are just staying at night and whole day out, then its a good hotel to be with. But if you are the type that really want to enjoy even your room stay at night then better look for other hotel... unless they already refurbished the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Best location in the city of Sydney”
Reviews.Author: SETYADARMA
Reviews.Content: 5 minutes walk to Paddys market and monorail station. Behind of the hotel is china town full of shop and restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for a business stay”
Reviews.Author: finistere50
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Holiday Inn Darling Harbour a number of times over the years and am generally satisfied with the rooms and hotel facilities. This time, like all times, I had trouble finding the place (even my sat nav had issues giving me sensible directions) but I got there in the end after a long day of travel and meetings. Check in was okay - though I was surprised when the fellow checking me in mocked (that's the right word to use) my Platinum Priority Club membership - but because I was tired I let it go. As always there seemed some surprise when I asked for valet parking (it costs, but it's a whole lot easier than doing it yourself). On going to the room I found it clean and equipped with the necessities. The bed was also good. I presume that I was upgraded because I was on a higher floor, but I wasn't there to look at the view. Generally speaking all the rooms that I've stayed in appear to have been the same. On both nights I ate in the bar restaurant (the only avialable option). It was quick, not overpriced and tasted fine. Breakfast is almost aggressively bland. Internet isn't cheap. The tariffs at this hotel are good by Sydney standards and, while not in any way memorable, it's a perfectly acceptable location if Chinatown / the Entertainment Centre end of town suits your needs.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, good room, nice breakfast, start cleaning rooms early though!”
Reviews.Author: LarryAbroad
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel twice in the last 4 months, travelling for business. In General: It's a good hotel with a mix of Business and tourist guests,but with more Tourists (given the exchange rate at the time, an Intercontinental or Crowne Plaza is just too expensive to those looking in GBP). I was allowed to check in very early (about 8am), given good corner rooms (both times) with a separate Bedroom. Staff are freindly and effeicent, delt with check-in quickly. Hotel is clean and everything worked/was as would expected. Room: Clean with a decent sized TV, sofa and separate bedroom, fridge. The bed is very confortable. Only one comment about the room - the second morning was a saturday and at 8am the cleaner tried to get into the room.. seemed a little early to start especially on a weekend day. Bar: The bar downstaiurs is good serves a range of Australian beers, little creatures, broages, etc - closes early, (about 11pm) Food: Didn't eat dinner but the breakfast is excellent - lots of hot/cold food available, differenmt juices and breads.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & Tidy, Great location”
Reviews.Author: joffw
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn Darling Harbour is in an excellent location. It's across the road from the Sydney Entertainment Centre, so is perfect if you are attending an event there. Close to China Town, the markets and a few minutes walk from the centre of Darling Harbour make the location a stand out feature. I stayed here for business and found the rooms clean and tidy. Staff were pleasant and provided helpful advice when asked. The bathrooms are looking a little dated, but were still clean and tidy.

Reviews.Title: “Good Service and Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Larry M
Reviews.Content: Though initially a little cautious, the hotel provided great service. They let me check in early , and book a late check out. All request handled professionally. The only drawback was a (twice) disjoin between adverts 'in lift' for reduced prices (Australia bars very expensive) at happy hour and a difference price(not as reduced) ; when pointed out at recpetion they just passed. at bar. Great location for China town and the variety and quailty of food there.

Reviews.Title: “Good Central Sydney CBD location”
Reviews.Author: gypsymum
Reviews.Content: Close to everything that Sydney has to offer, on my last stay I was upgraded to a Deluxe room - which was nice! If you are coming to Sydney for a show/concert at the Sydney Entertainment Centre you wont find a better location. The only surprise was the orange 'feature' wall in the deluxe room..... Clearly I'm out of touch or have no taste ! I've stayed at this hotel a number of times, rooms facing the Entertainment Centre are fairly sound-proofed, the elevator is secure with your room card required to operate the lift, I've eaten at Shipleys restaurant for dinner which was reasonably priced with a nice selection of foods at the buffet dinner. Breakfast for one included in the cost and taken in the restaurant was not reasonable when all I had was (one serve, no seconds) of a croissant, fruit platter and a cup of tea. If you choose to have breakfast in your room the extra charge for room service delivery of AUD$7+ is a joke - for that price I'll take the lift to the kitchen and pick up my breakfast myself. Sydney is a great city to explore with near by car parking - monorail, light rail and Central train station close by - what's not to like!

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at a great location”
Reviews.Author: liveforholidays-44
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night In February & had a really enjoyable stay. The room was very clean & tidy but possibly getting a little worn looking and the tiles in the shower were cracked. We were woken up from the next door neighbours banging their door, but not much you can do about that & the pillows etc were great. The staff were the highlight, very friendly & efficient. The location is fantastic opposite the entertainment centre and only a short walk to Cockle Bay and fabulous restaurants. $40 parking is generally around the going rate for CBD, so no surprises there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location close to Darling Harbour and George Street”
Reviews.Author: patch4750
Reviews.Content: A colleague and I stayed for one night prior to an early morning flight from Sydney airport..as a better option than the airport hotels. Speedy checkin and checkout. The hotel building looks a bit old but the inside facilities are good, rooms clean and tidy and free wireless from the room. The concierge was very helpful in directing us to a restaurant. One of the three lifts was out of action so there was a bit of a wait at one point while a large tour party found their way upstairs. Of interest was that the room keys didn't need to find a slot, just waving them nearby activated the door and the lift. Pretty convenient if you have your hands full. Didn't notice and street or room noise.

Reviews.Title: “One night stay”
Reviews.Author: yorkshirelad05
Reviews.Content: As we were joining a cruise from Sydney we only needed i night's accomodation so having had good service from Holiday Inn in Hangzou when on business I decided to try the Darling Harbour Hotel. We arrived by air at 7.30 a.m. and proceeded to the hotel expecting to wait until 2 p.m. for the room but to our pleasant surprise a room was made available on request at 08.45 and we were able to freshen up and make the most of our full day in Sydney. The following day we requested a late check out and was again impressed with the obliging reception who allowed us to use the room until 1.30pm and to go directly to our cruise ship for the 2pm check in. Breakfast was good with the usual buffet continental at 20$AUS each or hot style and extremely efficient in dealing with the diners. The room on 7th floor was the typical Holiday Inn, very good size, clean and equipped with tea making facilities, fridge flat screen TV. The bed wasking size, very comfortable with a choice of pillows. The extra surprise was the circular monorail passed by the side of the hotel, this provides a very quick and easy form of travel to most areas and you can get an all day ticket which if you make more than 1 trip is very attractive.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic facilities in a great location”
Reviews.Author: wineandcheesedayz
Reviews.Content: The check-in was efficient and friendly, the room with a queen bed upgraded to a corner room with a king size bed and 180 degree views of the city and Darling Harbour area. Bed was extremely comfortable and pillows of different firmness available ( I had a beautiful soft down and feather pillow ) and the blinds meant that the room stayed dark. I absolutely loved the mini-bar, as they state, as you like it. The fridge is empty, so instead of having to pull out all the beer, soft-drinks etc. to put in your own wine, soft drinks and water, it is exactly how I like it. All mini-bar standard fare can be summoned by room service, so if someone is wanting to order something they havent anticipated wanting, they can.

Reviews.Title: “pretty good hotel”
Reviews.Author: LeahandRyanH
Reviews.Content: this hotel is right downtown, right across the street from paddys market (literally a 2 minute walk, if youre slow like me) and its a great place to get food and really the BEST priced souveniers in Sydney. Trust me! The downside to the hotel was that we were on level 11 (top floor) and that was great, except that we had 4 suitcases and once we got to the top floor, there was a set of 10 stairs that led up to the room (no elevator access. period.) other than the stairs, the hotel itself is a good walk from either the railway stations "central" or "museum". even "town hall" was a walk, so if youre not big into walking, be sure to look up the metro system and plan accordingly. maps all look flat and there are lots of hills around. my husband and i were able to easily walk to darling harbor, the IMAX theatre, and the chinatown. room had a fridge (nice and cold) and bathroom was roomy. also, if you are trying to get to this hotel by shuttle bus (the one they state is $14 on their site info) it is NOT through their hotel and you will need to make different arrangements. its some other company that takes you about 50 minutes from what i was told to get to the hotel. plan your shuttle ahead of time!

Reviews.Title: “not impressed, despite good location”
Reviews.Author: Anoncat
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Holiday Inn based on a recommendation made by an acquaintance. I decided to go ahead since it IS Holiday Inn and its reputation has proved itself. Boy, was I wrong. Upon arriving, the rude receptionist told us that our room was not ready. Needless to say when we arrived at the room, we were not impressed. The furniture were dated and the carpet felt disgusting. I can tell it has not been cleaned for a long time. In the wee hours of the morning, there was an annoying generator sound from nearby that kept us awake. The only plus side is its convenient location. Despite this, I'd rather pay a bit more and stayed across the street at Novotel instead.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Maggiemaeann
Reviews.Content: We recently attended a concert at the Entertainment Centre and chose this hotel to stay in overnight. It is just across the road and it was great to be so close after the concert finished. We parked our car in the Entertainment Centre carpark and as we left later the next day it cost us $60 all up. We had drinks in the bar of the hotel which is spacious and opens onto the street. We had dinner around the corner in Chinatown and breakfast in a cafe in Darling Harbour. We had a room which fronted onto the street on the first floor and being a light sleeper I was initially worried about the noise level also the Monorail went past the front of the hotel but we did not find it a problem. It is a little pricier than others in the area but for convenience and closeness to the Entertainment Centre, Darling Harbour, Chinatown and some theatres it is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Good sleep”
Reviews.Author: MontiNb
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Holiday Inn as we were attending a concert at the Entertainment Centre. The hotel is across the road, perfect location for this. Check in was ordinary and the parking options was self parking at the Entertainment centre for $20 per day or valet parking for $45. We chose valet parking hoping that our car would still be there at the end of our stay. This was interesting to see your car being reversed up the street from their driveway against the traffic at peak hour madly waving their hand out the window. The room was clean and the beds comfortable. We had drinks in the bar before the show and it had a nice atmosphere. We did not eat any meals at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for this good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ali_Hawkins
Reviews.Content: The best thing about the Holiday Inn Darling Harbour is its location - it's so easy to get to anywhere - the Chinese Garden, Entertainment Centre, Darling Harbour, Cockle Bay, CBD, Monorail, City Trains and Chinatown are all so close you can touch them! The hotel itself is great - right up there with the best Holiday Inns I've stayed at - fabulous breakfast, wonderful staff service and overall just a great stay. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Good Sleep, Bad View”
Reviews.Author: aussie_si
Reviews.Content: Nothing really to write home about with view out of the room. The rooms themselves are of a good hotel standard. One plus the Breakfast and Gym are really good! Location is also good

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: pugsly14
Reviews.Content: Just needed a night in Sydney before an early morning flight so easy decision to stay here as I have been before. I am satisfied with the Holiday Inn chain and the location of this is so close to Central Station and Darling Harbour. The bed was comfortable and the room was spacious. No need to complain!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for the price”
Reviews.Author: lindaby
Reviews.Content: I booked the Holiday Inn Darling Harbour after trying to find a reasonable hotel in Sydney in a good location for elderly parents before we took a cruise. The hotel is an older Holiday Inn and doesn't have the spaciousness and new features of some of the newer hotels, but the location is great. My parents (80'-90's) enjoyed the area and walked down George St to the Opera House and to the Rocks and Botanic Gardens! You can get the train back from Circular Quay. While we took a taxi to the hotel from the train station is a close walk and I went back to the airport to fly to Adelaide for a day. I took a taxi to the airport but tried the train back and was faster and much cheaper. The Market Place is a block away and a huge warehouse of multiple stands for Australia souvenirs and other things at the best prices we saw in Sydney. Chinatown was great for low cost lunches. All in all a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: counterpoint
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a really convenient location - on the fringe of ChinaTown and close to the CBD. The one drawback is car access which is not well thought out and in fact is a bottleneck with guests arriving and wanting to off load luggage and others leaving. That combined with shuttles offloading large numbers can be chaotic. I had to drive round and round waiting to get a place. Valet parking is offered but that is only after the rather messy arrival arrangement. The Reception staff once I actually got in the hotel were great - friendly, courteous and helpful. The room I stayed in had been recently renovated and while basic was clean and a reasonable size. The bathroom had not had an equivalent make over it seemed to me and was old fashioned but clean. It would have been a lot better if the bath had been removed and a shower cabinet installed. Admittedly I have an aversion to showers over the bath and doubtful shower curtains. Good toiletries. The restaurant has an excellent buffet breakfast but it gets very busy. Dinner in the evening was much quieter and the food was well presented and the service willing and friendly. Altogether a really pleasant Friday - Sunday stay.

Reviews.Title: “A good base to explore Sydney”
Reviews.Author: YorkJean
Reviews.Content: Very welcoming staff.Lovely quiet room. Hotel very busy because used pre and post cruises.Staff helpful and pleasant.Breakfast hectic so went by bus to Bills.

Reviews.Title: “very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: sam63
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night. Location excellent, short walk to almost anyway in Sydney CBD. Reception staff and conceirge very helpful and friendly. Room small, but exceptionally clean and quiet. Bathroom compact and toiletries high standard. Bed so comfortable and good selection of pillows . The pillows are labelled ie medium, soft, and extras are located in the wardrobes. We will stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Not the holiday inn I normally know”
Reviews.Author: susanashton2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been staying at Holiday Inn establisments for as long as I can remember and never before been so angry. First the reception is ok, on our first night when we got in we did not want to have to leave again for dinner, Well to our supprise we could not eat here one restaurant was closed and the JBs bar was so full of people that had come in from the enterntainment centre you could not get anything to eat. Also you could not hear yourself talk the noise levels were awful. When I spoke to the duty manager she was not bothered at all could not of cared less. We were here for four nights and on two of them we c uld not get in to eat dinner. /the rooms was so mixed matched it was very mixed matched. The curtains were very old and the wall had been painted orange to try and make it feel more modern. This would of been ok it the rest of the decor had been changed to blend. The bed very comfortable the cleaning staff very friendly. The reception staff could smile a little more, All in all not the best place to stay on your visit to Sydney. We are priority gold members this hotel does not compare with other Holiday Inns we have stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean room”
Reviews.Author: Hiddenite
Reviews.Content: This is the second time i stayed in this hotel (mainly cos of its location and price). First time i got upgraded to a room large enough to accommodate 4 pax. This time the room was much smaller but still alright. Although the monorail is right outside (i stayed on the 4th floor), there's hardly any noise. Concierge staff was friendly and helpful but the front desk staff look like they need a holiday badly (maybe it's cos it was 2 Jan when i arrived??). They all looked like robots without a smile on their face but were efficient. One thing about the room is that the bed and pillow is too soft.

Reviews.Title: “Good position for the Darling Harbour area.”
Reviews.Author: Toptown
Reviews.Content: A reasonably priced option when staying in central Sydney. The room was a bit dark but well furnished. The restaurant is OK . The check in staff can be under pressure at times as this is a very busy hotel. We stay here once or twice a year. It compares well with other Holiday Inn hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Close to China Town, Entertainment Centre and great transport”
Reviews.Author: Beagle007
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is located across the road from the Entertainment centre. There is a 24 hour McDonalds directly across the road if you feel like fast food. It is adjacent to the Sydney China Town precinct. The food in this area is so good and so many places to eat that I cannot mention. It is a 4 minute stroll to the Paddys Markets. Markets that sell fruit, veg, meat, clothes and anything else you might want to purchase. The markets are located below what is best described as a shopping centre with a supermarket, banks, bars, TAB and other specialist shops. There are some shops similar to factory outlets throughout Sydney and Brisbane. Great value and some good deals to be found. The room was quiet. I had a room overlooking the market building. Internet was wired and around $20 per day. In this age of Wifi etc - it should probably be complimentary. The room had a queen size bed. Large enough for me alone. For two people the room would be adequate and spacious as well. The shower/toilet area is simple and does include a bath tub. The toiletries provided were sufficient for the stay. Check in and check out a relatively efficient process. I ate one morning in Shipleys Restuarant. This is a buffet breakfast. This was included in my room stay. Else the fee was $25 i think for breakfast. I can say that it is overpriced. The restuarant is small and you may need to line up for a seat from around 7am - 8.30am. The food was basic, the quality, ordinary and the selection very restricted. The water had run out in the tea dispenser and when I asked could it be filled I received a strange look from the attendant which amount to "go away". I think you could find some better options locally for the $25 they charge. Overall the hotel is clean, great location. Serviced by trains, buses, and the tram system. You can board the tram and be at the casino in less than 10 minutes. An easy 8 min stroll to be around the Cinema and Sydney Town Hall District.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised!”
Reviews.Author: Trave1_lover
Reviews.Content: The Holiday inn isn't usally a hotel chain we stay at but given the limited availablity of hotels for New Year in Sydney at the time of booking we decided to go for it and I have to say it was an excellent stay. Arrived on New Year Eve and despite check in being extremely busy we waited less than 5 minutes. The staff were pleasant, asked us about our plans for the evening and gave handy tios about where was best to view the fireworks etc. We were given a corner room on the top floor which was modern, clean and extremely well equiped. There was a seperate sofa and arm chair and made a very relaxing stay. The bathroom was basic but functioned as you would expected and had nice toiletries. Running late for New Year dinner reservations the concerige went out of their way to get us a taxi (this was difficult as lots of the roads in the area closed NYE) which was really apprecaiated. They were equally helpful at the end of the holiday including printing directions to the Hunter Valley as we had hired a car. The bar was nice and reasonably priced - especially at happy hour. The hotel is in a good location for Darling Harbour, Exhibition centre, China town and Paddys Market. There is also a monorail station across the road meaning you can easily get around the rest of the city centre. The only negative was the cost of wifi, however, if you stand outside facining MAcDonalds opposite you can pick up theirs for free! All in all great value for money and an excellent stay in Sydney, look forward to staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: kim m
Reviews.Content: As we were going to see a concert at the Entertainment Centre this hotel could not of been any closer!!!!! Staff were very friendly and the beds were the softest and most comfortablest beds I have slept in in any hotel. As we were travelling with our 3 and a half year old son, I loved the fact that the mini bar was empty but could order drinks or mini bar items from housekeeping as I hate going to a hotel and my son pulling everything or wanting everything from the minibar. Although in the middle of the city, you could not hear a single noise from outside due to to double glassed windows. The only thing that I didn't like about the hotel was the bright orange feauture wall in the room!!! Definitely stay at this hotel again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Trish411
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after a long train trip. It was comfortable and quiet. The location is excellent. So close to so many different things. I would defiantly stay again. The only thing is I wish they still put some things in the mini bar e.g. Water. But that seems to be standard these days.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for darling harbour and convention centre”
Reviews.Author: VangeInternational
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel built in what used to be a storehouse, the staff are effective and efficient though I wouldn't say over friendly. I was afforded all the usual customaries that a platinum priority club member gets, with a room upgrade. This hotel has good rooms great views over to the right of darling harbour and is in easy walking distance to Darling harbour, the powerhouse museum, the markets and Sydney entertainment centre is across the road, and china town just behind. All in all a very good and handy hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This is a fantastic hotel for out of towners....”
Reviews.Author: Fimum
Reviews.Content: I got a very good deal with expedia, it was their mystery hotel, so I thought the hotel was exceptional value for money. In my opinion the location is superb, very quiet because it is not near much through traffic but very close to a very interesting part of Sydney. Great food at reasonable prices close by and a lot of the venues many regional visitors would be in Sydney for, Darling Harbour, the Entertainment Centre, Power House Museum etc. The room was neat and clean, the check-in service fast and the concierge service good. The $20 flat 24 hr parking fee at the Entertainment Centre car park was good value parking for the area, allowing us to check-in one afternoon and spend the whole next day in the area without having to worry about parking. The only reason I have not given this 5 stars is, it is not what I would look for in a Sydney hotel if I was an International visitor. The area could really be part of any Asian city, not just Sydney, the hotel has very few rooms that offer a view and the hotel is very much a typical International hotel that lacks anything uniquely Australian.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Calypso501
Reviews.Content: I stayed overnight for business and this hotel was very well situated (if that's possible in Sydney), has friendly staff and the room was very clean and spacious. Very comfortable bed. TV reception was ordinary but then again I haven't seen one hotel yet that has clear broadcast. No problems about recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience but ...”
Reviews.Author: winequaffer
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not really on Darling Harbour but is only 7 minutes walk along a beautiful park walkway. We asked for a better room... you want a high floor, facing the main street... otherwise it's concret views. Our room was excellent, modern, spacious but our friends had a lousy room so it's worth asking. The hotel is really close to Chinatown which worked out well. All in all for the price I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, well situated and lovely staff.”
Reviews.Author: Smeagol_11
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights on a weekend trip to Sydney - mainly for Harry Potter: The Exhibition! I arrived early (around 10.30 in the morning) but hadn't arranged an early check in. The staff were more than accommodating in organising this for me. Being a little forgetful I locked my keys in my room - twice! They were happy to organise to come and open it for me. The rooms are very clean and the pillows were so comfortable (one firm, one soft - labelled!). Th eonly problem I had was that the fridge was not cold at all. I was a little hesitant to use it for food just in case as it really didn't feel cold enough to keep it well. The best thing about the hotel is definitely location.Central to everything, it was great for a weekend away, going out and seeing some great fireworks on the Saturday! Perhaps a little pricey for what you got, but with the location it was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but poor room setup”
Reviews.Author: 1place1dream
Reviews.Content: The location is great if you intend to stay around the Chinatown or have business across both sides of Darling Harbour. However I dislike the room. The table and chair do not go, making it uncomfortable for me to work on the computer. Very basic furniture, the only sofa seat is what you would have at grandy's.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and good location”
Reviews.Author: Southdown_Man
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for new year, alittle over priced for new years eve, but not too excessive. Good location for Darling Harbour and main street. Nice welcome on arrival, room was comfortable and clean. Bathroom quite acceptable. JB's bar okay, food not really up to much. Breakfast was very good, nice selection of all types of food. Pre-made tea in pump flask a bit disappointing. Overall a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Average and Overrated.”
Reviews.Author: Blurre
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for Christmas and new year, it was overall average. Location is good, and have sauna facility. However, our room wasn't made properly 5 out of 7 days, which includes towels in the bathroom didn't get replaced, icebox was turned off while we have drinks inside, and the queenbed was actually assembled with two single beds, the crack in the middle was quite obvious, my back suffered sleeping in it, for a 4 star hotel, seriously? As we spent most of the time outside, this wasn't a huge issue, but what happened on the day we checked out really pissed me off. We were going to catch the 5am shuttle bus to the airport, so we decided to wait at the lobby after watching fireworks, for 3 hours. My friend wasn't feeling so well, she fell asleep on the sofa while waiting, a while later, a staff came over, woke her up saying she's not allowed to sleep there. Soon afterward, he came to us 3 times, 3 times!!! Checking whether she was sleeping!!! In a rather unpleasant manner...and I was awake the whole time to make sure we are not in anybody's way. I understand he was trying to do his job and everything. There were 3 people in the lobby in the middle Of the night, is it really that importany to wake someone up in your empty lobby? After spending $1500 staying in this hotel, we do expect to be treated properly when we leave. Or at least have the decency to train your staff well enough to speak politely.

Reviews.Title: “A nice stay”
Reviews.Author: ACTTraveller2009
Reviews.Content: Location is everything with this hotel. Its close to China town, Paddy's market, Entertainment centre and Darling harbour which is full of waterside restaurants , shopping and playgrounds for the kids, you can also walk to the Star Casino or catch light rail or the Monorail. Our room was on the 8th floor in a renovated King bed room, it was clean, quiet and comfy. There was a variety of pillows to choose from and you could piggy back onto the McDonalds WiFi from your room , although sporadic. We also had breakfast each morning included in our rate. It was good, lots of options, fruit, yoghurt, pastries, toast, bircher muesli, bacon, sausages,eggs and pancakes. You could also squeeze your own fresh juice , apple,carrot etc it looked great. The concierge staff were very helpful, providing maps and storing our luggage. Another person who deserves a mention is the guy running the breakfast room, friendly and professional. Its a value for money stay and we like middle of the road so we can spend more on dining and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location if you're a turist”
Reviews.Author: tomasztomczuk
Reviews.Content: The journey from the Sydney Airport takes a while, especially when it's happening Friday Afternoon. The location of the hotel is perfect in every way, the hotel is next to: 1. the Chineese district - it's nice to grab a oriental dinner 2. concert hall - it gets crowded when something is happening there 3. fresh fruit/vegetable/meat/fish market - turn left when you exit the hotel 4. Sydney Fish Market - take the tram and enjoy the fresh oysters that are triple the size of the one available in Europe 5. Darling Harbour - you can grab a boat around Sydney Harbours 6. Next to the tram that runs over the streets and takes you around Sydney Turistic Places The stuff at check-in is very welcoming, it was quick and we were ready to move to our room. The rooms are simple with classic bathrooms, everything cleaned. We had an extra sink with a little kitchen area which we found to be unnecessary, but it might be helpful for families with children to make an extra snack for them. The mono rail trains are running on the second floor, you would probably want a room at a higher floor as there is a possibility of noice. Our room was at fifth floor and we had no problem with noice. There is a concierge desk opposite the front desk which is very helpfull. There is also a restaurant in the hotel, I have used it once for coffee with my friend.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fine rooms, appreciative staff”
Reviews.Author: Northern-Observer
Reviews.Content: We travel a lot and found this hotel to be one of the best weâ€™ve stayed at for its comfort, service, and location. We stayed twice, before and after a cruise, first for five days four nights, then for two days and one night, so our impressions cover seven days of experience. Arriving in Sydney from Los Angeles leaves you a little drug out, and at mid-morning, wishing you could check into your hotel early. We had made this request when reserving our room, and were accommodated just a few minutes after we arrived at the hotel - this was really nice. The maids had just finished cleaning the room, it required inspection, then we were given keys. On our second stay, just after our cruise ship arrived we immediately got keys to our room early. The staff seemed to appreciate we were guests. We had a corner suite on the 5th floor the first stay, and a deluxe queen bed room on the 8th floor the second stay. Every night both rooms were dead quiet, very spacious with a large lounge area, private bedroom in the suite and large bathroom including both a bathtub and a separate large enclosed shower in the suite, with a combination tub and shower in the deluxe room. Housekeeping services were thorough. Both coffee and teas are provided, along with a hot water pot. The coffees are freeze dried in thin packages which you (we) might not recognize right off. Small milk containers were provided in the small refrigerator. We carry a lot of electronics and appreciated the excellent number of electrical outlets, all Australian 240 v style needing an adaptor, with one 120 v North American style outlet in the bathroom suitable for low current devices like an electric razor or cell phone charger. The wonderful, trouble-free room keys you just hold up to the door pad, no swiping through some slot. Elevator service is great, with not much wait, just remember to hold your room key to the elevator floor pad to let you select a floor (a nice security feature). Two great conveniences were the in-room written hotel guide, the best Iâ€™ve seen in the completeness and comprehensive coverage. Second was the concierge desk was always staffed with two very helpful people for tours, events at the Opera House (concierge got us great seats together for the ballet Merry Widow when the on-line said only 7 scattered seats were left), or the nearby (7 walking minutes) superb Capitol Theatre (we saw the stage musical Mary Poppins). Great location for this hotel. Walking distance to the Capitol Theatre, right next to Chinatown (food was everywhere), Sidney Entertainment Center across the street, a short walk to the Darling Harbor park, ditto for the Chinese Garden, a quick 2 minute walk to a monorail station and the light rail, a TicketMaster booth right across the street, bank ATMs nearby, major shopping less than a three minute walk (with major grocery store, wine and spirits store, wonderful food at Barbyâ€™s Bakery, and everything else), and rapid access to taxis. We did not have a car, and after looking at the layout of Sidneyâ€™s streets, the traffic, and driving on the English side of the road, we were glad of this. The only downside to our stay was expecting internet access to be included in the room rate as is common in the USA. Both wireless and wired internet are available at a charge. We used our ATT MiFi instead. A very big plus is this entire hotel is nonsmoking, so you can always enjoy taking a breath. We did not use the hotelâ€™s room service, nor try their restaurant (seemed popular), nor the on-premises bar. Great hotel, when back in Sidney we would certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location/ Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: brownscorpio
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located, just a 10 minutes walk away from the darling harbour. So you have a nice option to hang-out. McDonalds is just across the road, wherein you also have a free wi-fi. Again, near to the hotel, you have a market, where you can find lots of shopping stuff at cheap and bargaining prices. The rooms are well-equipped, but you don't have a complimentary internet, so you may need to rely on the free wi-fi from McDonalds.

Reviews.Title: “Economical and pleasant stay in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: kmra
Reviews.Content: We booked a room for one night only at this hotel. We requested the staff to give us a very quite room with a decent view. They provided us with a reasonable size, very quite room at the seventh floor. The views were not to boast about and the room was surprisingly very basic. However, the quality of the bed was very good and room and the bathroom was clean. Overall, they offered a good accommodation at a decent price (179 AUD) in Sydney. I would definitively recommend this place!

Reviews.Title: “Good location good service”
Reviews.Author: kentlad
Reviews.Content: Right next to Darling Harbour and adjacent eateries and bars. Also Chinatown and Paddy markets and IMAX close. Service good and kids eat free option always a winner with Holiday Inn. Access by car can be a challenge due to one way streets so plan your route.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: aussiepom53
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here several times and found this time the staff were very friendly and helpful. Location is ideal for conference/entertainment centres, the harbour area and Chinatown/Paddys market. Restaurant area is small but the staff are helpful and efficient. Another bar area serves food for most of the day and is relatively good value for this area of Sydney. Can recommend it for a stay when in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value”
Reviews.Author: PeterSandgate
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located inside the shell of a historic building, although the interior is strictly modern, the decor being about 30 years old. For Sydney it is a mid range hotel with an excellent location opposite the Sydney Entertainment Center, and at the edge of Chinatown and Paddy's Markets. Both Central Station and Darling Harbour are a 10 minute walk away. I stayed there with my daughter, initially they gave us a room with a double bed, not sure whose fault that was but they gave us another room with 2 singles very promptly. Staff were pleasant and the place seems to be well run. The Sydney Monorail actually runs across the front of the building but due to double glazing there was no noise at all, and the airconditioning is efficient. As our room had a locked door leading to the next room it looks as though rooms can be made interconnecting for families. Room service was good quality food at a reasonable price. The rooms are not overly large or luxurious, and well in need of renovation, plus the awful 1980's bathroom had a mold problem on the tiles. There was a notice up saying that for the convenience of guests the minibar had been got emptied out but but could be restocked on request, which annoyed me, as I don't really like drinking Sydney tap water at 2am. Beds were comfortable and there is a choice of soft and firm pillows. For the price this is good quality accomodation and I would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “decent hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: andcil_11
Reviews.Content: this hotel was just about what i expect from Holiday Inn. Decent sized room with LCD TV and reasonably up to date bathroom. One of the towels in my room was dirty and they challenged me on the discount voucher that i had... other than that, the one night i spent was comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but needs an overhaul”
Reviews.Author: trinzeon
Reviews.Content: Stayed again at HI at Darling Harbour while traveling for work. It is always reasonable value for Sydney. Decor and furnishings very dated. Check in and check out can be painfully slow. Staff is friendly but could be better trained to operate more quickly. Location right next to Chinatown, so not great variety of food right nearby. Elevators very slow. I stay out of habit (and because generally I like Holiday Inn and Crowne Plaza's) but may try someplace else next time

Reviews.Title: “Nice new hotel & great central location”
Reviews.Author: HaydnAustralia
Reviews.Content: I normally would stay near the airport but there's not a lot to do out that way in Sydney, so I thought I'd give this one a go. Nice new hotel...very friendly staff. Check in was a bit slow but the room was very clean and the bed was 1st class. The pillows we tagged 'soft' and 'firm' - nice touch! Whilst the room was a touch small (aren't they all now?) the fittings were of good quality. Shower water was nice and hot and a decent flow too. I was a bit disappointed with the room's iron - quite old and clunky and not great heat control, but the ironing board was OK. The buffet breakfast was really good quality and price. List price was $24.95 but if you get in before 7.30 am the price for the full buffet is only $19.50. That's pretty good value in Sydney. The restaurant isn't that big so get in early. I do love the location. A 5-8 min walk to Town Hall railway station, Chinatown on your doorstep. There is a great food hall in the Sussex Center complex just around the corner and for $12 I got quite a bit Chinese meal that was really nice. Darling Harbour, the I-Max Theater etc all no more than a 10 min walk, if that. If you are in Sydney mixing work and a bit of pleasure I think is could be worth a look. I was a bit unsure about noise but my room was on the 6th floor and I didn't hear a sound overnight. Lower floors might be more of an issue but that's an assumption on my part. Well done Holiday Inn! Good effort.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay Great staff”
Reviews.Author: MTDfromCanada
Reviews.Content: We arrived after a 24 flight, had asked for early check in and where very quickly accomidated. Our room was very clean and quiet (at the back of the building) the street and monrail are right out front. We where there for a week. Conceriege staff could not have been more helpful. Explaining local buses, trams and monorail as well as tour operators for day trips out of town. The resturant although fairly expensive had great "specials" several nights during our stay. Many local resturants nearby and China town only a block. Location is very good to see the Sydney sights. Across the street is a McDonald with free WiFi if you have to stay connected. Internet rates at the hotel somewhat high.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and a good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: VishalBh
Reviews.Content: I was travelling to Sydney on business. This hotel is quite close to the Darling Harbour and China town. My stay was quite comfortable and the room had all the basic amenities that I needed for such a long stay ( 15 days )... like iron table, tea maker etc. It had a laundry room as well. Though I did not eat in the hotel most of the times .. ventured out to Darling Harbour and China town. Quite a few eating options around the hotel. The staff was friendly and the concierage desk was quite helpful in providing information about the tourist destinations in Sydney. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Not a great stay”
Reviews.Author: Riggles
Reviews.Content: Our stay here was some time ago,(March 2009) but thought I would add my review anyway. This was one of three hotels we stayed in during our visit to Australia, and I would rate it second of the three. The hotel is clean, well cared for, its within walking distance of Darling Harbour, which is loaded with restaurants. Unfortunately, that's about all the good things I can say. At best I found all the staff indifferent. Our room was very small; the bathroom was so small it was downright awkward. Something has to be next to monorail, and unfortunately it was our room. Several times an hour, the train flashes by, mere feet from your window, which doesn't open at all, making the room feel very stuffy. Probably the most annoying thing was on check out, we received a bill for very expensive phone charges. All the calls where made to my daughter's cel phone, none of which where answered, just rang. She lives in Sydney, so the charges seemed unreasonable for local calls. By my recollection, there were 4-5 calls, all no answers, and the bill was $70. When I protested the excessive rates, the front desk advised that they couldn't do anything about it, I would have to contact the hotel manager when I got back to Canada. After several emails, the hotel manager finally agreed to refund 50% of the phone bill, but only after I pointed out that their in room documentation did not advise of the hotel phone charge rate. Overall, it was a pretty unpleasant stay, especially in comparison to our stay at the Holiday Inn in Rooty Hill during the same trip.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Us”
Reviews.Author: Blueysmrs
Reviews.Content: We (2adults 2kids) arrived just after midday to the hotel &, even though the reception area was busy, we were served quickly & able to check-in to our room straight away. Staff member was friendly & very helpful, especially explaining where we had to go for car parking. Room was great - 7th floor & at the back - no noise! Two good size beds & lots of room for the kids to muck about. Very clean. Buffet breakfast had a good range of food (cereals, pastries, toast, yoghurts, fresh fruit, bacon, scrambled egg, sausages, hash browns, mushrooms, tomato that I remember). We ate twice at the JBs Bar - we enjoyed it & the kids got decent mains plus dessert, all for no charge (kids eat free policy). Hotel is right near Paddys Market, Chinatown, the monorail, Entertainment Centre & a really short walk to Darling Harbour. Checkout was busy but still only took about 10 minutes. We were happy with our stay & would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and nice standard”
Reviews.Author: growtoparl5
Reviews.Content: THe hotel is right in Chinatown which is good for restaurants and at Darling harbour for lots of attractions. Nice standard and has car parking. Rooms a good size and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, poor reception”
Reviews.Author: pixie0427
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because I generally find Holiday Inn hotels adequate and competent. That was a mistake. The receptionist was unwelcoming, unhelpful and untrained in basic manners. The check out experience was not a lot better. The food at the restaurant was just about average - I found better options nearby at half the price. If it were not for a friendly concierge and a terrific location, I may have checked out after the first night itself.

Reviews.Title: “Handy Location, Good Food”
Reviews.Author: Like2Travel08
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel very early on Sunday morning for arrival the following Saturday, room rate was the cheapest in the city for Grand Final weekend at short notice, but still quite expensive. An email prior to arrival suggested we take the shuttle or a cab from airport to the hotel. Our friends who arrived on Sat evening found there wasn't a shuttle, cabs vary in price hugely and be careful of ones which take you long way around. We only paid $39 but our friends paid $59. Train cost A$38 for two of us, but was underground for most of the way, get off at Central and walk isn't too far to hotel. Hotel directly across the road from Paddys Market, Sydney Entertainment Centre and cobbled walk to Darling Harbour and short walk to George St, QVB Building and Pitt St mall. Room modest, TV didn't work (we wanted to catch the other GF), took them an hour of too-ing and fro-ing to get it working. We were in old part of building, has double glazing to cut out most noise and once TV sorted all good. We had a couch in our room which I really appreciated, hate those two uncomfy chairs so many hotels have. Found we were in good company in the hotel, had a really good atmosphere and we ate in two nights and the food was great especially for the price. Hotel breakfast was nice but a little pricey compared to cafes at Darling Harbour. Hotel doesn't have a pool or outside space, so might be less pleasant in height of summer but as hotels go we thought it was pretty good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot, Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RESDNZ
Reviews.Content: Clean Tidy comfortable. Dated however hotel going through refurb, we stayed in the rooms yet to be refurbed Very Good beds and pillows Great water pressure, Big screen TVs for those who like sport. Great location, Chinatown on your doorstep for those who like Asian cuisine. Friendly and helpful staff. Look forward to staying again once the refurb complete

Reviews.Title: “Darling at the Harbour”
Reviews.Author: Chris_KiwiChris
Reviews.Content: Early September - stayed (2) twice in a week.... Sunday & Monday - then later chose to come back the following Friday. The point being - I never go back if I didn't like the first time....... Room rate(s) - very acceptable. Chose to eat just around the corner in China Town, literally, - well worth the visit...... On the first visit - we stayed (twin room, as requested) - 2nd floor. Very tidy room, good bathroom, top shower. Impressed that, altho the mono-rail passes right outside the window, you can't really hear it - the beauty of double glazing..... The bar didn't stay open very late even though there were a number of people, however, having own supplies covered that - asked Tami at reception for some lemonade and coke - was at the room in moments - well done..... Speaking of the bar - we found it rather incredible that they had no sports TV channel.... perhaps an excuse to have the bar vacated earlier - oddly enough, the room had sports channels........The bar seemed to have found it on the Monday night tho - when we weren't interested..... figure that eh... 2nd visit - the Friday - was opening night of the Rugby World Cup so we were out and about in town.... back to the room late - 11th floor this time - again, a nice rom.... but, could hear every inch of the monorail passing, and the jack-hammer of street workers early morning treat...... - double glazing is surely a must..... The concierge desk is polite and helpful. An extra chair in the room would certainly be sensible - but, this is common everywhere, they think only one person wants to sit at a time.....!! Shouldn't have to ask for a second chair....... And - warning - if you are left handed, don't pick the electric jug/kettle up..... it is designed for right handed people - there is a small steam vent on the side at the top of the handle - problem is, once you pick it up, it takes a couple of moments to realise, then you can hardly drop it......I got a significant and painful scald on my hand from that....... But, would I go back - yes......

Reviews.Title: “ONLY D NAME”
Reviews.Author: sanjiv18
Reviews.Content: it was really very bad exprience for this hotel it was good if i would have stayed in d guest house, because for every thing you have to wait and last they say they dont have please buy from out side i give you very small example i want the adpter to charge my mobile phone because of the pin it was different.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, what an improvement!”
Reviews.Author: Mloleary
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel a year ago. This time, I was given a recently renovated room that was so new, you could still smell the paint. The room's update has given this property a much-needed update. I would happily stay here again. The modern decor, clean rooms and a fairly good gym really appealed to me. The only thing I wasn't huge on were the staff at the front desk. They were either confused or poorly trained. When I arrived, there were four people behind the desk and no one else in line. Instead of ONE person (including the manager) telling me that they'd be with me in a minute, they all glanced awkwardly at me without really acknowledging my presence for a few minutes. Not a huge deal, but not a big confidence-builder, either. I didn't have any problems, so I didn't have to test them any further. On another note, the bell staff was extremely prompt and helpful. Either way, I would definitely return to this place.

Reviews.Title: “Below Par Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: steve_fossil
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel dozensof times over the last decade and in general am very happy with the quality of the rooms and the recent upgrade of bar/bistro and reception area. I was surprised that arriving to check in at 1.45pm that there were no valet parking spaces available. We were also not thrilled by the quality of the service and food/drinks at breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here alot over the years however something is missing”
Reviews.Author: Aussie5131
Reviews.Content: I used to stay here a lot mainly on business. After a year or so gap I arrived back at the hotel to find that like other Holiday Inns, it was re-branded with the new logo and new back drop to the reception desk. The service was as it was last time I stayed helpful and swift. I noticed though that two staff that always made my stay relaxing and enjoyable were missing. What happened to Josh (concierge) and Myron ( Duty Manager)????. Other than them having left, staff like Andrew, Scott and Jeremy on the bell desk and Amanda and Tae? on reception and Kate in the business centre helped with all my needs quickly and professionally. Besides the staff, the location of the Hotel is a added bonus. I found it was a quick walk to the restaurants and sites of Darling Harbour and China Town and also easily accessible public transport near by to get me to my daily meetings. If staying upgrade to the Executive wing, the Free Internet although slow is complimentary with these rooms. I would recommend this hotel to both Businessmen and women and also for the Leisure market.

Reviews.Title: “So much better than the alternative”
Reviews.Author: Paul S
Reviews.Content: I stayed the previous night at another hotel, which I have proved a review of on this site. I left due to disatisfaction with my experience. It is only fair that I write a review of my stay at the holiday Inn where I moved to the next night. This hotel is so much better. Comfortable clean rooms, nice shower, and friendly staff. I can be quite busy, and on a previous stay prior to the City to Surf getting an in room meal proved difficult. However, it was good to relax here after my race, and to get rid of the stress of my short stay elsewhere. I would return to stay at the Holiday Inn before next year's City to Surf.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, not so great service”
Reviews.Author: yomamemo
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for a short business trip. Great location, near the chinatown, darling harbour and train station. Hotel is a little rundown, quite unexpected for a well-known name. Front desk hotel staff doesn't speak good English, which is unexpected for a hotel in Australia. The water in my room was murky and I requested for maintenance personnel to come and take a look. The maintenance personnel came, and told me that this is common for water in Sydney! Surprised at that answer, but as I was alone, I just let it go and went to buy 2 large bottles of bottled water. Internet is chargeable (quite expensive) and there is limited choices for breakfast, but suffice for business traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Dated accommodation, more staff needed”
Reviews.Author: bearGC45
Reviews.Content: Stayed last weekend in 2 rooms -Queen Suite & 2 single beds (2 adults, 2 children) with interconnecting doors -tip: make sure you phone ahead if you require this, as we had a bit of trouble getting it. Rooms -6th floor-have been repainted but carpet needs replacing, clean but dated. Very busy hotel, feels like a railway station with people coming and going constantly. Breakfast a shambles as not enough tables, not enough staff, food running out - not worth $24.50 each, instead walk down to Harbourside or Cockle Bay whalf - $12.00 for brekky and better coffee! Location good if you want to see Chinatown & Paddy's Markets, next time we'll go back to Novotel or Grand Mecure on Pyrmont.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: JustineHS
Reviews.Content: Had a pleasant stay here with family. The rooms were clean and serviced daily, staff were helpful and knowledgable with Sydney information. Close to the Chinatown precinct, Paddy's market and Darling Harbour. Close walk to Star City Casino as well.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient little corner of Haymarket.”
Reviews.Author: jimmyjames182
Reviews.Content: Stayed here the one night for a function at the entertainment centre - 2queen room on the 6th floor. Room was clean, comfortable and quiet. Bathrooms clean as well. Bar and restaurant prices ok. $5 a pint, $12 for a chicken parma - beer was a little warm which, in australia is a sin but I survived. This is a quiet little corner of Sydney. 2 minutes to haymarket, steps from the monorail station, 10 minutes walk to central railway station, 10minutes walk to darling harbour. Little traffic though this is across the road from the entertainment centre and might get busy on a concert night. Parking tip - $15 flat fee at the entertainment centre car park if you pay at the ticket office. Beats the $40 valet for the hotel and took only 5 minutes extra. This was an easy stay for our family of four and I would stay again and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a Darling Harbour stay”
Reviews.Author: shanosV8
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night as a city sleepover with my kids after seeing a show at Star City casino. Hotel is in a super-convenient location for Entertainment Centre (literally across the road), China Town, and Darling Harbour which are all easy walking. Monorail and Light Rail very close which connects easily to Central Station. Overall pretty good experience staying at this hotel. Had a bit of a problem at check-in with wrong bed configuration in room (not as per my confirmed booking) but this was fixed reasonably quick. Stayed in a recently refurbished room, all pretty modern and clean. Good beds and pillows choice nice. JB's bar & bistro downstairs is excellent and reasonable prices. The restaurant on other side of lobby seems overpriced. Breakfast looked too busy in there but no problem because McDonalds is just over road. All up, good value short stay and will be back if I need to stay this area again.

Reviews.Title: “We have stayed there many times and this hotel is pretty good”
Reviews.Author: Artytheking
Reviews.Content: The service was mostly good but sometimes it was a little difficult to understand the people working there. Some of them spoke poor English but thier will to please was excellent and more than made up for this. The room was good, the location superb, right next to the wonderful picturesque Darling Harbour. It is a must see place to all who travel to Sydney. The downside, if there is one, is it is to near to the Chinese Quarter, when walking out in the evening, you can be constantly pestered by Restauran Staff trying to have you eat at their establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, rooms & service - but book carefully!”
Reviews.Author: WiltshireJulie
Reviews.Content: Excellent location within walking distance of all major sites, close to the monorail. Our rooms were clean, comfortable and quiet, despite overlooking the monorail and a busy street. Staff were helpful, although as other posters have reported, we also had an issue at check-in regarding the beds and rooms we had booked. Our booking via the Holiday Inn website was for two double/twin rooms, requesting a 'roll away' bed in one of the rooms if necessary, so that our teenage son and daughter didn't have to share a double bed. However, we did not anticipate this would cost an additional $55 per night, until we were informed of this upon checking in, and felt this should have been made clear during the booking process. We finally came to a compromise, and eventually were charged $55 extra for the duration of our stay, instead. We chose not to eat at the hotel, but had some reasonably priced meals in the Food Court at Paddy's Market (try Second Cup cafe for a substantial breakfast!) and in nearby Chinatown.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Miseryolo
Reviews.Content: The hotel location is excellent but you pay for it with large parking bills, think hotel parking was around $40.00 per day. Room was nice to sleep and fairly quiet, bathroom is terrible and looks 40 years old (i was on top floor-11, my co-worker was on 10 and he said that his was fairly new, so maybe they are still dong some renovations) Breakfast in the hotel was below average and as somebody else mentioned WHY ARE AUSTRALIAN HOTELS CHARGING THIS MUCH FOR INTERNET... bring your own 3G... Hotel bar was shut at 10pm, so make sure you are not going back to hotel for a drink. All in all it is adequate place for a business traveller, but for a holiday trip there are number of better hotels in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Internet Access EVER”
Reviews.Author: chaoswarriorx
Reviews.Content: Infuriating, expensive, and punishingly slow, the internet usage policies at this hotel are awful and border on abusive. For $25 / day you are capped at 200mb, after which you are either capped @ 15kb/sec or you need to pay $.10/ MB. As a web-savvy, highly connected business traveller, this is unacceptable. I have hit the 200MB by evening after 2 days of standard working and using VPN to access remote machines. I huge disappointment. If you need decent internet access, stay elsewhere... If this is the apart of Sydney you need to be in, I'm sure it's fine. Chinatown is right behind, and the Convention / Exhibition Center is nearby. I'll give them that the room is spacious. Breakfast is not included, and is expensive and not especially nice. Save your money and eat at one of the many other options near by.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and in a good location”
Reviews.Author: aion12
Reviews.Content: Overall I would stay here again, and use it as a hotel for travel, but not one to hang around in the whole day. Good: -good location -plenty of staff around the lobby -clean room, good lg tv - both hard and soft pillows provided -mostly comfortable bed -spacious room -bathroom was good -more than usual storage space in hangar -airport shuttle ($12) -mcdonalds across the road, if desperate for food late at night Not so good: -room not ready at check in time of 2pm -no microwave -bed did sink down a bit in the middle -the bed looked to be a double instead of a queen size, called reception to check this -room was a bit dark Arrived at 1 and was told the room was not yet ready (check in was for 2). We went out to china town, literally 30 meters away for lunch, came back at 2.15 and the room was still not ready. I noticed a number of other guests waiting in the lobby for their room as well. I was offered drinks vouchers for having to wait

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but some service and cleanliness issues.”
Reviews.Author: ozFinn
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel cannot be beaten for access to the Entertainment Centre and Darling Harbour. However check-in took far too long, as there was an issue with the type of room (and beds) we had been assigned. The woman checking my wife and I in, alternated between blaming me for not selecting the correct bed choices when booking (I did) and then saying that it didn't matter anyway as the site we booked through would not guarantee bed types... Then blaming me for the mix-up again. Eventually we were granted an 'upgrade' to an executive room, which was no different from what I would have expected a standard room to be in a hotel of this class, excepting perhaps the king bed. The shower had been cleaned to a rather sub-standard degree. There was some hair around the edges and some torn wrappers in the soap dish. The toilet at the end of the refresh cycle also let out a load shuddering groan, which could probably be heard in several adjacent rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Globaltrading
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for almost Aud 500 per night for a double double bedroom and found the hotel was not as expected as a 4 star hotel. Nice hotel but overpriced. The location is near to China Town (5 min walk) and Darling Harbour (10 min walk). The breakfast was just average. Tips: Try the ribs @ Hurricane in Harbourside Mall. For a family with kids, Taronga Zoo is a must. Take a Family (2A 2C) package inc. ferry and cable car. It's cheaper. Sydney has a free circular bus (no. 555) around CBD (from George street to circular quay, Sydney Opera House and The Rock)

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: Musarat
Reviews.Content: I stayed in holiday inn for 3 nights...we checked in at 1am in the morning..I had my 2month old baby with me. 1st they gave us a room which was for disable. we managed the 1st night since it was late. When i went in the morning to ask if they can change the room and he the front desk was this girl her name was Diksha..I have stayed in so many hotels but i have never met a front desk staff as rude as her. she was a total stuck up, no interest in her work and she dint even smile.This was just the beginning of a nightmare, she gave us the most rubbish room the bed was broken and heater was not working, we had to change the room at 11.30 at night, the room they gave us after that was the same, the heater was not working, but we managed it becoz its very hard to move from one room to the other with a baby. When i went to check out it was the same girl and she charged us for 3movies when we only purchased 1..i told her we purchased 1 and 2 movies were purchased when we were not even in the room..and she just said hurry up there is a que behind. i told her i won't pay, she just took the mastercard from me in such a rude way. I will never ever stay here. four points is the best

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: sfergo
Reviews.Content: I agree with the last reviewer, the hotel was just average. Nothing special but I found the staff to be excellent and friendly and very accommodating, especially Mali at the front desk. And that's what counts. My room however was in level 1 right outside an ally. It wasn't right next to the monorail but I did hear the monorail. I didn't hear any guests like I do in most hotels so that was good but I heard a lot of street noise from my room and a truck backing up and the driver talking outside woke me up. If I go again I'll get the more expensive rooms and try getting a room at the highest level. I may stay again if I ever have another concert next to the Sydney Entertainment centre. But as for location, this is perfect. If you have a concert in the Sydney Entertainment Center and don't mind being tired the next day stay in Holiday Inn Darling Harbor. I also found their prices for breakfast very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, great location”
Reviews.Author: Nicky1001
Reviews.Content: Stayed for business at the end of May / early June. Last time I visited there was a fair bit of construction, thankfully that was complete. Comfortable room with the usual amenities, plus a choice of firm or soft pillows. Not exactly a 'pillow menu', better than no choice. Location of course remains fantastic, right next to Chinatown and Darling Harbour, light rail and monorail stations nearby. I was attending a conference at the Sydney Exhibition Centre, easy access by light rail was great in wet weather. Staff were friendly, especially breakfast staff. The only disappointments were a bit of unsightly unpainted plaster repair in the bathroom, plus indifferent air conditioning (but this is typical of larger hotels, and there was in-room control).

Reviews.Title: “Room was great, but hotel just average”
Reviews.Author: Peak_Performer
Reviews.Content: The greeting at the hotel was good and was quite an easy checkin proceedure. When going to my room, I found the hallways a bit musty in smell, but this dissapeared when I entered my room. The room that I received was a corner room that had a sperate room for the bed and bathroom. This was a great room and made the stay enjoyable. Parking is a problem at this hotel, with the carpark a 3 minute walk away (which will be a problem when its raining or really hot). The monorail runs right out the front of the hotel and sometimes you can hear it running when you are in your room. This wasnt an issue for me, but felt it could be for some other guests. Overall this is just an average hotel with many others around the area offering a better place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: Methim
Reviews.Content: Ideal location within walking distance of many attractions and a monorail station only a few minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “A Holiday Inn in walking distance to Sydney's Chinatown.”
Reviews.Author: diosito111
Reviews.Content: My first impression of Sydney---when arriving at George Street---was that of an Asian city, due to the dominating presence of Asians there. When I arrived at the hotel, the (mostly Asian reception) staff greeted me with that blend of Asian courtesey and Australian coolness and humor. I got there early in the morning, so that I had to wait for my room to be ready. That did not bother me in any way, as I had a scheduled departure with the Grayline people for the Grand Sydney tour, taking me also to Bondi and Manly beaches. I was, however, disappointed that the hotel charged me AUD$ 5 for a 30 min access to their W-LAN router/Internet with my laptop. There is a shuttle bus leaving from the hotel for the airport every 30 minutes, charging only AUD$14,--

Reviews.Title: “Commercial Hotel - Well located”
Reviews.Author: Navneetbhaiya
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located near the darling harbor although not all rooms offer the view of the harbor. The hotel is more suited to business travellers than tourists.. The rooms are well spaced and comfortable, the food (breakfast) was good and the reception/concierge desk were helpful in providing travel tips. There are some other hotels at the darling harbor which might be a better option of tourists

Reviews.Title: “disappointed, but not all the hotels fault”
Reviews.Author: tajandmark
Reviews.Content: great location, the hotel backs on to China town, with Darling Harbour just a 5-10 minute walk away. The hotel lobby is pretty much the same as most Holiday inns, clean and tidy. Check in was swift and hassle free, the room was nice, however our room had a connecting door to the room next to us. This was paper thin and we could hear our neighbours tv clearly along with every loud word (in Chinese) they spoke up to 3am. Maybe they were hard of hearing, maybe I'm moaning, either way a good nights sleep is something I didn't get at this hotel. A real shame as we really enjoyed our time at the Holiday inn in Cairns, and as such expected a similar experience here. That said, the gym was ok, nothing special, the shuttle bus to the airport was on time and Darling Harbour is a beautiful place to spend an evening. Would I stay here again? Probably not, which I know isn't entirely fair as it wasn't the hotels fault I couldn't get any sleep

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: oscarpebbles
Reviews.Content: I must admit I was dreading staying at this hotel. I had passed it on previous occasions and the thought of the monorail running past, entertainment centre across the road and my least favourite corner of Sydneys CBD. Well that all went out the window when we booked in. The Hotel is behind Dixon street in China Town and a short walk to Darling Harbour. We chose this hotel as it was one of the last ones left for the weekend we were there (Mardi Gras was on as well). My wife loved the idea of being in Chinatown. The reception staff were very friendly and upgraded us on check in and immediately upgraded us to a family suite. Now you may think they new I was a DE expert on TA and used my persuasion, but no I don't say anything when I book my hotels as I want to be able to give unbiased feedback. The room were given was an unusual configuration in the fact that when you entered the room you are on a landing and you step down into the room. This gives you the feeling that you are below ground as the only window was set at shoulder height. Mind you we were on the first floor so I am not sure how the other floors rooms are configured. Since we booked through an agency for a special rate the hotel also offered us a deal on breakfast so with our original intention of dining elsewhere for breakfast we decided to eat at the hotel instead. The breakfasts were great. Nothing to write home about just a good selection of cereals, hot food and fruits as well as bottomless tea and coffee. The part of the buffet that surprised me the most was they did two types of bacon, Crispy and ,well, not crispy. There is a computer you can use in the hotel for a fee if you require internet and anything that you require extra will come with a cost to it. No problem, budget generally means just that, you get what you pay for and you pay for the extras. There is also an airport transit service that is offered at this hotel so that you don't need to organise a taxi or public transport. So, would I stay here again, Yes, if it was a short stay and the price was right I'd have no hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality on the cheap... missed the things that make a stay enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: Rolrbl8der
Reviews.Content: Just finished a 4 night stay... and am happy to be moving on to another city with the prospects for a better hotel. Just about the only aspect of this hotel that's worthwhile is the location. The breakfast wasn't all that bad (though the eggs were inedibly runny). We had to change rooms after receiving the first one they gave us as there was a lot of jack hammering and construction noise directly ouside our window. The room was in poor condition, so we were happy when they moved us to another room. The second room was slightly nicer, but still in poor condition. You know that great feeling you get when you first walk into a hotel and you just know you're going to have a great experience. Well, that isn't the feeling you get when you arrive here. When we booked this hotel with our travel agent, they said it was in the 4 star hotel class. Not sure if that's true, but definitely not worth that ranking. The appropriate marks for this hotel would be about a 2.5 star hotel. Yesterday while walking through the harbor, we stopped in at the Holiday Inn in Old Sydney. What a different experience when you walk in. It's obviously why they are such much higher ranked than this Holiday Inn in Darling Harbour. As far as the Holiday Inn in Darling Harbour, we were most disspointed by the high charge for internet, lack of baseboards in the room, no loaner umbrellas for rainy days, misinformation from conceirge service, smokey lobby, and unhelpful and grumpy staff at reception desk.
