If I return to Sydney, I will definitely be choosing another hotel as this one's rundown and operated on the cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Comment”
Reviews.Author: BEC0208
Reviews.Content: All staff were friendly and courteous with simple clear answers to any questions, The room over looked the street, monorail and across to the Sydney Entertainent Centre, Harbour side Museum and upper D Harbour. Initially we thought that the room would be noisy due to the Monorail and Street frontage. However, to our very pleasant surprise we enjoyed superb soundproofing and were not aware of any outside noise pollution. This and the fity meter walk to the Monrail Station and 2 stops to Queen Victoria Building made this hotel an excellent cost effective choice.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location”
Reviews.Author: Chris H
Reviews.Content: This is an ideallly situated hotel for anyone visiting Sydney. Breakfasts were good( always pre book!!- as they are expensive locally). China twon is literally around the back of the hotel. Paddies Market is 2 minutes away. Darling Habour is situated about 10 minutes walk - very pleasant! Fron there you can get the ferry or water taxi into Sydney Main Habour. Walking can take 40-50 minutes for those who like to walk. For us this was an ideal location to visit the city. Public transport is within 2 minutes of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Do not pay more than $120/night for these rooms.”
Reviews.Author: DocSurf
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in a deluxe suite that had a sitting area and a bedroom with ensuite. Standard room rate was about $370/night and I used a stay 2 nights for the price of one voucher thorough my priority privilege membership. The first room we were booked into had problems like a hole in the roof and thick dust from plaster wall repair sanding that had not been cleaned so we were moved to another room. The reason I considered staying at the holiday inn was because of their extensive advertising about the refurbishment of their hotels ( my past impression of holiday inn was that it was a bit run down). All that has been refurbished is that the old cheap carpet has been replaced with new cheap carpet and they have given it a coat of paint and use new linen. The furniture is very dated and show signs of approx 20yrs of wear and tear. The toilet took 2-3 flushes to clear the pan every time. (pretty feral) The staff seemed dead tired and not very interested in being there. The bed was very comfy though. If you are able to get a standard room here for around $100 then it is probably worth what you pay but there are many other nicer places in Sydney to stay. I will not stay at holiday inn again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Presentable and Close to the Action”
Reviews.Author: Lunarboogie
Reviews.Content: The wife and I spent a weekend in a standard room on the second floor of the Holiday Inn Darling Harbour. It was a weekend and it was cheapest place going round. We paid $179 per night which was better than any where else by far. The monorail sauntered directly past our window every 6-minutes but youâ€™d have to be an exceptionally light sleeper to let it disturb you. The room was large, clean and functional. The cushion top bed and choice of firm pillows made for an excellent nights sleep. There are no frills here â€“ I can tell you that for nothing. But if youâ€™re low maintenance, donâ€™t need the accoutrements of 5 star digs and can land a good deal than this place is well worth considering. Wifi is available at a cost but we managed to snare the free wifi from the McDonalds immediately opposite the hotel. Who said globalization was all bad?

Reviews.Title: “My prefered hotel in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: raetia
Reviews.Content: We had a six night stay here this time; it's my fourth time at this hotel. We had a superior room on the 9th floor and with the exception of a curatin railed bath/shower i liked the room. The location is good, the tram/monorail stops close by, Central station is a ten minute walk and the ferry in Darling Harbour a little more (as the stop has been moved 300m further away). Staff were very helpful, though we had to ask for coffee top ups at breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Location is this hotels biggest plus!”
Reviews.Author: thehamburgian
Reviews.Content: To say it straight - the location is the biggest plus for this hotel though it is not really directly at Darling Harbour. But at the edge of China Town and directly next to the Paddy's Markets and only few minutes walk away from Darling Harbour it is pretty central. Mono Rail and Tram have stops within 500 meters from the hotel. For business travellers like me it probably depends on where they need to go, our office is near the airport which is about half an hour by cab away from teh hotel. The rooms is average, no frills. A mini bar is in the room but empty, so one has to/can fill it by oneself with stuffbought from the nearby convenience stores. What I didn't like at all was the breakfast. To be honest, teh second day I went across teh street to Mc Donalds...

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: ajcobb
Reviews.Content: They have done some recent upgrades, all that is needed is some better touch up(nail holes, paint, etc.). We arrived on the first AM flight to Sydney and were at the hotel at about 8:30. The reception staff got the room ready within an hour, and did not charge extra for the very early check in. The cleaning staff on our floor was very friendly and helped us to understand how things worked in the room. Our reservation included breakfast, and though I would pay the normal charge, it is worth a bit more in the reservation price. They have 3 newspapers available in the lobby, and Mcdonalds free wifi can be picked up in part of the lobby. We were pleasantly surprised as our past Holiday Inn experiences in the States have not been as nice.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: TonyT5
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews about the Service and the Monorail noise, i was less than happy my wife had booked this Hotel, Lots of people moaning about the noise from the Mono rail outside the rooms on the Second floor at the front of the hotel, We got our keys from a clean friendly and very polite reception and headed up to the second floor ! Opened our door felt a bit disapointed at the two single beds even though our preferance was for a double ! The room was Massive and too big if im honest ! Opened the curtains and there it was the big metal mono rail. Well i can honestly say the noise was no where near as bad as some people made out. We were never woken once ! it was almost non exsistent ive stayed in more expensive hotels in bigger citys and had traffic noise keep me up. (New York) Yes you can hear it now and then but it simply was not a problem, we pushed the beds together and had a two perfect nights sleep. The Monorail is a Plus in my book as the station is a minute walk from hotel and you can buy a single day ticket for $9.50 and your in the heart of it all in minutes if you dont fancy the walk ! Darling Harbour has fireworks at 9.00pm on Saturday and is not to be missed. bars and restaurants for all types of food. Try the Meat & Wine Co ! Awsome food and excellent setting. The Entertainment Center opposite had a concert of some sort on but the crowds dispursed and we never really heard any exccessive noise as they left The room was spotless and the bar and resteraunt were excellent. Location was a 10 minute walk from Darling Harbour and 30 seconds to the Market City (Chinese Market) I picked up the MCDonalds Free Wi Fi on my Iphone from the Hotel Bar, Resteraunt and Lounge. China town is quite literaly round the corner, and as such theres no shortage of places to eat and drink. To get to the Shopping center were the Sydney tower is located was a 15 minute comfortable walk, All in its a very good friendly and clean hotel in a good location Room was well eqipped and spotless. If you want silence 5 star luxury and perfect service with the best possible location look elswhere and be preppared to pay double what this hotel costs ! Some people expect Hyatt or Hilton class at Low cost Hotels, dont set your sights to high. Remember Holiday inn are low cost hotels and as such things are not perfect If you want a good value clean hotel in a good location then you could do a lot worse than Holiday Inn Darling Harbour.

Reviews.Title: “Fine, but better options”
Reviews.Author: brmusicman
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night as business took me to Sydney. Overall, it was a fine stay -- the place met all of the requirements and was as-advertised. I do think there are better options in Sydney, however, for a similar price. My room was fine; it appeared to have been renovated. The desk was large and well-lit, the bed was comfortable (with very nice pillows), and the bathroom was clean and had both a tub and shower. I appreciated that the room had a refrigerator, robe, and slippers, along with a nice set of bath products. Everything was completely clean. Decor was very basic, but had a modern feel. The public areas of the hotel were not as nice as the room. Hallways were dark and had scuffed walls; the lobby, while it had some new decor elements, had a dated look. The fitness center was absolutely miserable. I didn't try the dining options within the hotel -- you'd be silly to do so given how many great restaurants are within walking distance. Service was fine. Not outstanding or overly welcoming, but everyone did their job. My platinum status with Priority Club was not recognized nor rewarded with any additional perks, but this is my general experience with Priority Club (and is in such contrast to Marriott, Hilton, and other chains, which go to great lengths to reward loyalty). The hotel's location is good; it's at Darling Harbour and therefore is near dozens of restaurants, cafes, etc.; the light rail and monorail are steps away and it's not a bad walk from the Town Hall station for other rail services. So, overall, I was pleased -- hence the "very good" rating. Where I think the hotel falls short, though, is on what it offers for the price (or, at least, the price it was charging during my visit). I wasn't disappointed per se in any aspects of the hotel, but when I compare what I got for my room rate to what I've experienced at other Sydney hotels for the same price, the hotel does not favor comparably. (For instance, I've paid the same room rate, during the same season, at a Hilton, where I had a much nicer looking hotel, a room with better decor, better service, breakfast, etc.). So, my recommendation is to comparison shop. If you find this hotel at a great comparative rate, go for it -- there's nothing really wrong with the place. If you find it's charging what other hotels are charging, I'd give a careful look at some of those other properties.

Reviews.Title: “Just not a 4 star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: JK0001
Reviews.Content: Booked on hotwire and had a bit of a go round with them and american express as this was billed as "four star". I did not agree, and do not agree after my stay. Holiday Inns are not four star no matter how you slice it. Going into the hotel we immediately were told our room was not ready and were asked to wait over an hour and a half. No upgrade when I inquired mid wait, just were given a few drink coupons. Then we were given two single beds, I guess we must have mistakenly signed up for the Flying Nun package. Again, complained, which yielded no upgrade, but....more drink coupons. Very weird and disappointing. The location was fine, but all in all, this was just a three star experience, unless enough drink coupons buys another star. Sorry hotwire, not four, not even close . I will think twice about HW going forward, which is too bad because previous experiences had been good. Otherwise, clean and reasonably furnished, but its a holiday inn through and through.

Reviews.Title: “good location and yum cha next door”
Reviews.Author: rollingstone7795
Reviews.Content: stayed in late january and the room was what i expected. pretty clean, pretty much all i needed for a business trip. always busy in the lobby and the bar is a bit lacking. went to china town around the corner and got a great meal. good stay but not amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Central, quiet and well-equipped”
Reviews.Author: mumontherun
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Holiday Inn Darling Harbour for four days in January with teenage children. We had a triple room, well-equipped with sink, fridge, tea and coffee-making, safe, ironing board and iron, hairdryer, cable TV etc. Internet was available. The bathroom was a bit dated, with the main issue being the two taps for shower use. It was fine once we worked out the ideal setting (e.g. one tap at 6 o'clock and the other at 3 o'clock), but that took a bit of work during the first shower to figure out. Also, the shower dripped incessently unless very firmly turned off. Those are very minor issues though and didn't affect our stay. This hotel was much quieter than I expected. The hotel faces the monorail line and the huge Sydney Entertainment Centre, so has the potential to be a noisy place. However, the windows have full double glazing, so we noticed little noise from outside. Likewise, there was a large, screaming family staying a few doors away from us on the first night and I was worried that we might be disturbed by them, but there were no issues with noise from other rooms and noise from the corridor was minimal. We left the car at home and came to Sydney by public transport, as parking is very expensive and traffic very congested. The hotel's location was very central, being a 10 minute walk from Sydney Central and Town Hall railway stations, just around the corner from all the Chinatown eateries, and two minutes' walk to the Darling Harbour monorail and the Pyrmont light rail line. Buses are about five minutes walk away, on George Street. It was unusual to find a hotel offering a room with three single beds, which suited us perfectly, being one adult and two teenagers. The beds were comfortable, and well supplied with a variety of pillows. I don't like mini-bars (the fridges are often tied shut with a cable tie), so I appreciated that this hotel room had a fridge, but that they did not automatically include a mini-bar - you could call and ask for this if you wanted it. So we found this very convenient as we had brought our own breakfast supplies and needed to use the fridge. On the whole, we liked this hotel and would place it at the top of our list of places to stay again in Sydney for its convenience, quietness and excellent level of room facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Ok- not the most convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Holidaytravelfan
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located between Chinatown and Darling Harbour so if you take a wrong turn, especially at night, you might feel a bit uncomfortable - especially as a female. Rooms are ok, nothing special. ItÂ´s about a 10min walk to Darling Harbour and quite far from Sydney Harbour. A supermarket is close by in a shopping mall. Public transportation is close by. If you get a good deal itÂ´s ok, otherwise I would choose a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ok but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: aus_isis
Reviews.Content: Clean and close to darling harbour. Rooms a bit dated and external noise came into the room. Bit of a walk to cbd. Reception was often under staffed and a bit slow. If you can get a good price it would be ok, otherwise there may be better in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: supatrippa
Reviews.Content: The service we experienced was good, not excellent, there were no smiles but at least they were efficient. We arrived early in the morning from New Zealand and had no problem storing our bags until we could check in in the afternoon. Check in was a breeze. We had a twin room on the 8th floor which faced the rear of the hotel and was very quiet. The king single beds were comfortable and spacious. The location was great for us as we were only in Sydney for 4 days for shopping, eating etc. Holiday Inn is within easy walking distance of the train station, Paddy's Market just across the road and Chinatown literally out the back of the hotel. Overall I liked the hotel, after all it was only a place to sleep and store our shopping til we went home. The thing I liked the least was that my sister got scabies from her bed.

Reviews.Title: “Never Ever Again”
Reviews.Author: APeckham
Reviews.Content: The staff we encounted can best be described as rude and indifferent. From the lack of concierge so we had to unpack our car out in the street in front of oncoming cars to the receptionist stuffing up our booking to 4 people staying in the room with only 2 towels, 2 half rolls of toilet paper, 2 tissues in the box, 2 drinking glasses. The room had the monorail 1.5m from our windows and runs past every 7 minutes from 6.30am to 10pm. No mention of that at time of booking. Laundry charges are outrageous (even Versace doesnâ€™t charge that much!). We stayed for 2 nights but they put it over 2 separate bookings so we had an urgent message for us at 7.30am telling us that we needed to book in again straight away and come downstairs to do it. Then when we left they double charged us not once, but twice and we have spent 7 days trying to get our money back. Holiday Inn should be ashamed to have this hotel in their chain. If you are a traveller please look at other review sites and donâ€™t just take our word for it. NEVER EVER AGAIN!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Touristy hotel right in China Town”
Reviews.Author: runbhk
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for work, but it's clientelle seem more tourist oriented. The room was large and clean, with a decent set of toileteries in the room. No free wi-fi though, but didn't get this in any other hotels in Australia. The staff were friendly, in particular the receptionist who helped with an early check-in and a complimentary upgrade because the booking agent had got the reservation incorrect. Location-wise, it's right in the heart of China town (literally behind the hotel), and a 10 - 15 minute walk from the CBD.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location Ok Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Janny_9
Reviews.Content: Our room reminded me of one of those old fashioned dorms, 3 single beds, not quite what I was expecting for an overnight stay, but we got a great rate and the location is fantastic. Close to all the tourist spots. We have stayed at this hotel a number of times previously and I cannot remember the rooms being so sparse. I cannot remember their being a 1.5% surcharge for using a credit card. I cannot remember room service tasting so bad. I cannot remember the valet watch me struggle with luggage. I cannot remember being so disappointed with the hotel on the whole and I cannot remember being so happy to check-out. If I ever have the occasion to book accomodation in Sydney again, I will give them another go because I do remember them being better than this.

Reviews.Title: “Service Fee Heaven”
Reviews.Author: Bluegold818
Reviews.Content: This place loves their service fees. To start they have a 1.5% fee to use a credit card IN ADDITION to the room charge quoted online. Then they charge about $10 for 2 hours of internet and $27 for 24 hrs. Self serve laundry costs $6 and breakfast is $15. The rooms themselves are old and bland and the gym has a grand total of 3 treadmills. Stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Hotel Sucks”
Reviews.Author: KiwiDave13
Reviews.Content: Very central and in a great spot, but the hotel is very poor. The curtains fell down in our room and they still made us sleep in it. The queues for a breakfast table were long and frustrating. There are so many other hotels in the area, we will stay somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again.”
Reviews.Author: AndrewAstro
Reviews.Content: This was one of the worst customer service experiences I have ever had. 1 â€“ When we went to check in there was a very long line up and I was double parked outside, I decided that it would be better to move my car to the car park while we waited, so I went to the concierge to ask for a ticket to the car park across the road. The concierge was very nice and gave me the ticket and explained to me how the ticket worked. I was in the process of moving my car when my FiancÃ©e rang to advise that the receptionist would not check us in as the booking was in my name, even though the concierge advised the receptionist that he had checked my details when he gave me the ticket for the car park and it would be ok to check us in. I had to re-park the car and run back to the hotel to show my licence. The receptionist was on the phone during the whole time we were checking in and barley cracked a smile. 2 â€“ When we checked in to the room there were not towels. Small thing I know, but at $300 a night we should not have to ask for towels. 3 â€“ The biggest problem was when we checked out. We paid cash for the room to the receptionist and the account was all cleared up, just as we were leaving my Fiancee asked how much money had been held on our CC for the room, the receptionist advised $400. This was a shock to us as no one had advised that they would be holding so much money on our card, and when we checked in the receptionist advised they would be taking just a swipe of the card. Never did they advise that they would be holding so much money, if we knew this we would have paid for the room up front and paid a cash bond. The receptionist advised that it would take 5 days to return the money to our account. We have no idea, and the receptionist could not explain, why they would hold $400 for the room when it only cost $312 and they already had an imprint of my credit card from when I made the reservation some time ago. We advised that half of the reason that we came down and stayed the night was to shop for Christmas and the $400 that they were holding was a large chunk of our money. After a long discussion with the receptionist and then manager we made an arrangement for them to charge our CC with the $400 and then they would refund that amount to us in Cash. Although this was not the best solution, we agreed. However the next day when we checked out account, we had been charged $400 TWICE and no refund. I then called the hotel back and after talking two to very rude receptionists, spoke to a manager who really did not care at all, he just advised that we would have to wait for the bank to refund the first amount charged. If the receptionist staff just did their job none of the above would have been an issue. Holiday Inn just need to learn some basic customer service. AVOID THIS HOTEL AT ALL COST!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but room can be better”
Reviews.Author: sunflowersiupig
Reviews.Content: (+) - very good location; easy access to transport and food - nice breakfast with various choices - can access free Wi-Fi from MacDonald's if lucky (-) - very busy; good for business but not for leisure - delay on room check-in; makes us wait for 1 hour! - bed bugs... - we're at the 2nd floor where it is right next to the track of light rail; surprised to sleep next to the rail - no free Internet

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Klc6444
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location very close to Darling Harbour where you will find the Aquarium, IMAX, Wildworld, HarbourSide (which is an excellent mall) tons of great places to eat and an excellent place to sit back and people watch. I felt very safe as a single female in this area. I walked around with no concerns. The monorail was a huge help taking you to all of the great locations in the area. The Opera House was about a $15. taxi ride. The Sydney Explorer hop on hop off bus was right across the street. You can pick up McDonalds free wifi in the lobby if you sit near the windows!

Reviews.Title: “Holiday inn- Standard quality,can not go wrong”
Reviews.Author: Mahuva
Reviews.Content: good claen hotel, indifferent staff value for money not luxury but central location, good public transport link. will go again. sydney opera close by, paid shuttle to airport lots to see close to china town

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: lonestar28
Reviews.Content: clean, attentive staff, nice rooms. good location - shops, retsaurants and lively china town just around the corner, short walk to Darling Harbour. Shuttle bus for airport service.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: lmpappy
Reviews.Content: Close to everything around darling harbour and China town and light rail network to star city casino. Double queen room on 8th floor was exceptional and spacious. Immediatly across the road from the entertainment centre. Staff very helpful will stay there again!!! Top Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: josmon10
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Holiday Inn Darling Harbour last year, and I didn't like it much, I thought the Holiday Inn Potts Point was so much better. However, this time my platinum elite was recognised and I was upgraded to a bigger and better room, with complimentary use of internet. From the outside the building is not very inviting, and inside some areas aren't much better. The fitness and health centre is a joke, and the spa is so small that it must be embarrassing being inside with someone you don't know. However, its location is great, right in the middle of Chinatown (night market behind the hotel -at least on Friday-, and lots of restaurants nearby open after midnight), and opposite Paddy's Market, with every major touristic spot walkable from the hotel. All in all, quite a good option in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Busy location, bit expensive”
Reviews.Author: Stacy37
Reviews.Content: Long check in line up, not enough hotel staff to handle the people checking in. Very very busy lobby. Rooms are not newly upgraded, a bit old but was clean. Hotel is directly at chinatown was great for chinese food availability. You must stand in line for the emporer puffs!!! They're great. Felt like I'd gone to China at times. Hotel is right near the hop on/hop off bus stop which is great. Concierge was very helpful, lent me an umbrella for the rain. Also was able to get a power adapter with a $25 deposit that I got back when I checked out. I think it was extremely expensive at $300/night but I guess that's Sydney prices. Compared to Canadian standards it was most definitely not a luxury hotel. Standard really. I stayed here because I am a female on my own for the weekend and didn't want to be too far away so I'd have to walk on any desolate streets. Worthwhile. If I went to Sydney again I'd probably look at a different location, only because there wasn't anything attractive about this hotel or the area nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Convienient but way too Expensive”
Reviews.Author: coutsa
Reviews.Content: Its a good little hotel, rooms are pleasant, staff were fine, but didnt really need them. But wow, what a rip off. Paying close to $250 a night AUS is highway robbery.

Reviews.Title: “well located enjoyable hotel close to restaurants”
Reviews.Author: JCB_8
Reviews.Content: I had two nights here last week and found check in was freindly and efficient, rooms were clean and quiet, service good and excellent value for money

Reviews.Title: “Avoid”
Reviews.Author: tony10014
Reviews.Content: Provided with a room with two REALLY short beds - I am six feet, and the bed is not. Spoke to Takeshi, the duty manager, who stonewalled me. Totally not worth the $400 cost

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay....”
Reviews.Author: monoz
Reviews.Content: Received free internet and upgraded rooms, the staff where ok , except for check out, very slow and not so friendly. Overall I would recommend this hotel the rooms have had a refurb, quite and location is very good.

Reviews.Title: “Ridiculously Expensive Internet”
Reviews.Author: ManilaPhil
Reviews.Content: Hotel is fine and in good location. I have stayed in the past and if I am not mistaken, the Internet was was either free or cheap. It is no longer. I was charged $27.50 a day for Internet service that was throttled if more than a small amount of data was transferred. I need to work from my room so had to pay it but I won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Very bad experience”
Reviews.Author: david5558
Reviews.Content: We were flying from Cairns, Australia after our five days stay in Holiday Inn, Cairns. That was a great experience. But once we arrived in Sydney, Australia, we found Holiday Inn, Darling Harbour, Sydney is a total different experience. We had a very bad experience with the hotel receiptionists and the hotel services right after we contacted the front desk. 1. The receiptionist Elizabeth this evening did not provide a warm welcome to us when we checked in. Instead, she gave us a long face with no patience. 2. The remote control of the TV set did not work in our room. We called the front desk but no one responded. Only after our dinner, we went to the assistant manager Myron directly then he sent someone to fix the problem. 3. The worst thing is there is no hair dryer in our room. My wife called the front desk three times and we waited for about 50 minutes but no one came to help us with this problem. My wife got a wet hair and went to the front desk directly and the receiptionist Pinko even lied to her that someone is going to help us. Of course, no one showed up. We had to go to the assistant manager Myron again crying for help. I have been travelling around the world for over 20 years and have been staying in many different hotels. This is the worst experience I have. I will let media and other people know that Holiday Inn does not have a good quality. The stay in Holiday Inn Darling Harbour, Sydney really ruin our holidays in Australia.

Reviews.Title: “Nice facade but inside tired and a bit rough...”
Reviews.Author: How-did-I-get-here
Reviews.Content: Once we discovered the marina, the maritime museum and the restaurants we realised the best part of this hotel is its location. When we arrived we were shown to a twin room which is fair enough because the internet said it was an option. I immediately (at my wife's insistence!) asked the front desk for a shift to a double which they were able to do, so can't complain. The new room was round the corner off the main street which, unless you're really into trains - monorails - is a big bonus!! My wife says while I was down negotiating with reception she was watching the trains go by the window! So watch out - ask for a high room away from the front. (There's a monorail station across the road which is actually quite convenient: the train is good fun and gives a good tour of the city centre.) However the new room got the full benefit of the rubbish collection lorries every morning. Why don't they have double glazing to at least reduce the noise! The hotel is generally rough. The rooms are ok but tired. We didn't eat in the hotel - there is so much choice elsewhere nearby. (There's a MacDonalds just across the road for breakfast although in fact we went to the coffee shop up on the main road.) Reasonably convenient for the shopping, a bit of a hike to the Opera House. Quite isolated and dark if walking back late at night but we had no trouble. Ok but I wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The most appalling customer service I have received at a hotel”
Reviews.Author: resilienttraveller
Reviews.Content: Don't bother trying to raise any conerns with the staff - they couldn't care less. The rooms look good but that's the only thing good about staying here. If you are staying in a non-smoking room you would generally expect that you would not have cigarette smoke from the adjoining room (locked door between 2 rooms) flowing into your room, particularly seeing there are signs stating there is a $500 fee if found smoking in the non-smoking rooms. A pity the staff didn't htink there was a need to do anything about it despite numerous requests. Having to sleep with the air-con on full overnight in an attempt to clear the room of the smoke is not what I consider a bonus to my stay!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Experience”
Reviews.Author: jresidence60
Reviews.Content: Recently, I stayed in Holiday Inn Darling Harbour. I had bad experience in particular for room assignment and staff attitude. After checked-in, I was assigned to stay in Room 344 featured with queen size bed but no bath tub. By that time, I had strong feeling that I stayed in the guest house. In such connection, I asked for Myron at reception to have room changed. As replied, my room accommodation supposed to be assigned this room category; handicapped room without bath tub. I reverted to the guy that I have never informed by the reservation staff which my room preference with queen size should be shifted to handicapped room. Of course, I do not mind to take the handicapped room, provided that the facility was decent. After lengthy negotiation, I told my wish to the guy that I would have a queen bed with bath tub for my stay. As reverted, no queen bed room was available, but twin bed room with bath tub was offered for me to change on that night as option one. Or he could arrange room change to queen bed room on May 06 as only 2nd solution given. However, the guy stated strongly that I should keep staying in the twin bed room for whole stay if I accepted to take 1st option. I thought that the offer of 1st option given was not made sense. As a result, I was fed-up to negotiate with him. Finally, I had no choice, but to take his offer which I should stay in Room 344. For your information, the bath room of room 344 had dripping water sound from the ceiling happened all night long. By that time, I asked myself that I should make the best of my tolerance as I need to catch the morning tour in the next morning. The next day, I was arranged to stay in Room 1110. To my curiosity, no one took initiative making courtesy call to me, which showed a minimal level of customer service delivery. Upon my departure, the most unforgettable experience I never had was Vchoto, your reception staff. Said staff handled my check-out procedure who can put her left hand in her pant pocket, not until making credit card payment for me. The above I narrated, I wish to share my bad experience to you. Perhaps, I made the wrong choice for accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: staceyss
Reviews.Content: The best part of this hotel is definitely the location. You're within walking distance to Darling Harbor (5 min) and even the CBD, Opera House, and all those sights (expect 10-15 min). Plus, there's a decent selection of nearby restaurants. Our room was fine--clean with a comfortable bed. For the price, I would have liked the room and hotel itself updated more. Just keep in mind that you're in one of the most expensive cities in the world, so your "hometown" prices/quality could be a bit out of skew with what you get in Sydney. And if you happen to have a kid that loves the monorail, you're in luck. It goes right by this hotel. My 5-year-old was in heaven!

Reviews.Title: “ideal place to see sydney”
Reviews.Author: noel1964
Reviews.Content: hotel was ok it was clean the staff were ok .hotel was well placed beside alot of the attractions in sydney ,rooms were clean and plenty of room the food a bit pricey good job china town nearby still would go back to it

Reviews.Title: “Great location, no frills but comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: CarrieLam
Reviews.Content: The best thing I like about Holiday Inn Darling Harbour is its location. Chinatown and Haymarket are just close by, and within short walking distance are Darling Harbour and the Sydney Fish Market. The superior room I stayed in was spacious enough and the bed was comfy. However, breakfast choices were limited. Some slightly different varieties each day would be appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, poor service”
Reviews.Author: ChrisBustin
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel mainly due to the excellent location at Darling Harbour - very convenient. The hotel seems to be used a lot by tour groups, so always tons of people waiting at reception. Checked in early afternoon, took 20mins as only 1 person on the desk. Didn't even bother with the queue at checkout, just dropped my card and left! Best thing about the hotel was the free internet. They have a good bar which has been recently done up. Rooms of a good size and quiet given the location

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: madhavkudva
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the hotel for two nights. The location is fantastic and a five minute walk brings you to Darling Harbour, with wonderful cafes, restaurants and museums. It is also adjacent to Haymarket. The Central Business District is a short walk away. The monorail station is less than a 5 minute walk. The bus station for the Sydney Explorer Buses( which goes to all the major tourist attractions on a day pass ) is adjacent. The hotel check in was swift and I found the hotel service helpful and courteous. The concierge was helpful and gave us useful tips on transportation and attractions. Choose a standard room with two singles . Clean and functional rooms with all the usual hotel extras. Choice of two pillows; one soft and the other firm. Thoughtful to provide an illustrative book on Sydney, with highlights on the major tourist attractions.

Reviews.Title: “good location, poor service n staff”
Reviews.Author: cleo30
Reviews.Content: we spent 4 nights in this holiday inn, with 5 rooms.after holiday inn cairns, which was our preceding hotel, it was a real comedown. the hotel has a great location..eating places, tourist spots and the nearby city and paddy's markets for shopping, but thats about it. the staff at the reception were uniformly surly and uncooperative, something i guess that flows top down from their asst manager mr. myron ting. the rooms were dark and dreary, with depressing dark grey accent walls and bad lighting.even the double rooms had only a queen size bed. the bathrooms had ghastly maroon tiles and a pathetic shower. the breakfast was a decent standard holiday inn one, but again their breakfast area was v crowded. next time, i would definitely look at other hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but didn't deal with early arrival well”
Reviews.Author: taninaus
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located just across from the Entertainment Centre and a short walk to Paddy's Market and Chinatown. Walking around the area at night felt safe as there were so many people around and it was well lit. But apart from the monorail it is a fair walk from any transport - busses are 2 blocks away, central railway is over 1km away (about 5-7 blocks uphill). The light rail and monorail are very close but only good if you are going to the locations they service (great for the shopping district or Darling Harbour). The location is more Chinatown than Darling Harbour - it is a short walk to the chinese gardens and the end of the exhibition centre but a long walk or monorail ride if you want the shops or cockle bay area. The 2 restaurants onsite were attentive and the wedges from the bar were fantastic (best cooked ones I have had in a while!). The restaurant had a wine and cheese tasting as I was going out at night - of course trying to tempt you back. Check in wasn't as good as I would have liked - I arrived about 11 so I could at least leave my bags. The problem was the receptionist wasn't helpful about possible timing for my room. I was told to check back at 12 to see. I got back about 12.45 and was told it would be a futher 1/2 hour so I had lunch. Went back about 3/4 hr later and I am not sure what happened but she seemed to scramble to find me an open room (about 2pm by now). I don't have a problem with having to come back later but to get told one thing and then it is 2 hrs later I have better thing to do - just tell me the room will be available at 2 or 3 pm and I will go explore the city and come back then. I love an early check in when I can get it as I get to freshen up but I understand if the hotel is busy that isn't always possible. The concierge guys were helpful when they were focussed (Sunday am they were a little too focussed on a ebay or such auction!) and the room was fantastic - large, nice toiletries, comfy bed, quiet. Having had a very noisy room at the Novotel up the road the room here was comparatively very quiet in the same area. One more thing that needs fixing is information about the internet access - the website has various prices that are no where near what the receptionist told me - very expensive. TIP - Save some $$ and access the free wifi from McDonalds right across the road - you may even be able to get onto it sitting in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: enzfrnz
Reviews.Content: I stayed on the second floor. The room furnishings could definately be updated. The room I stayed in two years ago was nicer. The location is fantastic, just a few blocks from Central Station and right around the corner from the monorail and light rail. The bed was ok. Staff very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Value, Location, Darling Harbour, Chinatown + a good nights Sleep zzzz”
Reviews.Author: KosBoy
Reviews.Content: Overall, Value for money stay, casual Hotel atmosphere and Location was very good....specifically Likes; 1. Value for money given proximity to Darling Harbour & other Sydney attractions 2. Location, opp Entertainment Centre & Paddys Market, behind Chinatown, 5-10mins walk to Darling Harbour 3. Monorail close by 4. Very comfy beds.....had relaxing and quiet sleeps (important after a hard days work or travelling) 5. Casual hotel atmosphere 6. Most staffs courteous and helpful 7. Breakfast was good and fast....with morning paper complimentary 8. Safe area, no problems walking to and from Hotel at night 9. On site Bar Dislikes; 1. Rooms a touch on the small side, but good overall 2. Gym was small and pitiful 3. some Rooms looked into other buildings or the Monorail (request Floors above L6) 4. Lifts were slow at times

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, comfy bed!”
Reviews.Author: Littlerachy
Reviews.Content: Was looking for a cheap room to sleep in on our whirlwind anniversary getaway. Booked the cheapest thing I could find on the net, prayed we would be lucky enough to get a queen sized bed, as the advertised rate stated "queen preferred" and that we would not be eaten alive by bedbugs! On arrival we were delighted to find the parking was half the quoted price and we had been given a complimentary upgrade! The bed was newly refurbed & plush, lovely high ceilings, fluffy robes and slippers, quality toiletries, silence and a late checkout - HEAVEN for our cheapo romantic escape! The staff were polite and efficient and the location was spot on, we were able to walk to a comedy show on George St, then over to Darling Harbour for fireworks and the casino was a $10 cab ride home. Thank you Holiday Inn!

Reviews.Title: “Good experience at Holiday Inn Darling Harbor”
Reviews.Author: BinsSingapore
Reviews.Content: Holiday Inn Darling Harbor is in a renovated historical building. I was at 11th floor. My room was excellent. Spacious en recently renovated. Staff is helpful and very friendly. Breakfast was good, although I was confused about the price options and surprised that prices changed depending on what time you took breakfast. Selling point of the hotel is its location. You can take great walk along darling Harbor and the Sydney city center. Down side I found the surprisingly heavy traffic that runs through the street in front of the hotel and the long wait at check out. Gym was closed, but running along Darling Harbor is a treat that beats the tredmill in the gym big time.There was also a paint job done on my floor, but that was trouble free for guests. Good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Copterman
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights at the Holiday Inn. Great location 5 mins walk from Darling Harbour. The monorail runs past every 10 mins but we didn't hear it at all in our room. Internet was very expensive as it seems to be in all Hoilday Inn's now.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and basic.”
Reviews.Author: Falksnviolet
Reviews.Content: Mixed views on this hotel. Because of the address we expected it to be on Darling Harbour and have Harbour views but this is not the case. It was however just a short walk away. There were long queues at check-in which meant we stood in line for longer than we felt appropriate and then had to fill in a couple of hours before our room was ready. The staff were rushed and curt rather than courteous. The lifts were tiny. Lift security was broken so access to any of the floors was a free-for-all. The breakfast room was far too small, with people having to queue for breakfast, which meant we had to wait and therefore rush our breakfast so that we could be at our business appointment on time. The staff apologised every morning for the lack of tables but apologies wear a bit thin after a while when you realise that nothing is actually being done about it. The young consierge was very friendly and helpful and the cleaners were friendly and polite. Our room was spacious, comfortable and very clean. The only reason I would stay there again is if I was attending a function at the Entertainment Centre as it is immediately across the road.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't fault it!!”
Reviews.Author: KymPerth
Reviews.Content: Fanstastic staff and service!! We recieved early check Inn at 11am after the midnight horror... exactly what the tried traveler needs! I also left some clothes behind which they very kindly express posted back to my home address. I must also make a special mention to Simon who assisted us with a quick room change after an issue with our minibar.

Reviews.Title: “Good value of money”
Reviews.Author: VenicePh
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at the hotel. Our room was a bit small but clean and comfortable. The location is fantastic, close to China Town and all the favourite tourist attractions including Darling Harbour and Opera House etc...Love the Malaysian restaurant called Mamak, just cross the road with yummy rotti!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent but some front desk staff need to be more informed”
Reviews.Author: Sherpas
Reviews.Content: The room and cleanliness couldn't be faulted. Wet bar prices were definitely overpriced. Very handy to Paddy's Markets, Chinese Gardens, Darling Harbour and Star Casino. Upon checkout though it took nearly twenty minutes though to get from the 6th floor down to the ground floor via the two very small lifts as one was out of action. A few people and two suitcases and that's it. Upon checking out though was advised by a young woman I needed validation of my parking ticket which had been carried out the day before. After speaking to the Consierge found that original instructions regarding validation remained. Not so when I went to collect my car, another 15 minutes delay. All up with the added 40 minutes it made things very rushed. Staff need to be more up to date with the smaller details such as parking which I found put a damper on the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: UWHusky1968
Reviews.Content: Checked in 2Apr10 and out 4Apr10. Booked thru hotelclub.com and saved $40 over best rate offered at front desk ($149/nite vs $169) - rates were high due to busy Easter weekend - noted on hotelclub.com that rates dropped to $119/nite for Apr 4 and 5. Room 426 had 2 twin beds, desk/chair, large sitting chair, TV with excellent channel selection, and a mini-bar with sink and small refrigerator - the bathroom had ample counter space and a good tub/shower - all very clean. A monorail station is about 100m away and provides for a quick tour of the downtown area. It's an easy walk - about 5 minutes - to Paddy's Market, or Chinatown, 10 minutes to Darling Harbour, and about 15 minutes to the many upscale shops at the Queen Victoria Bldg. The evening concierge gave us 2 excellent recommendations for dinner: Scruffy's $6.95 steak & chips dinner was perhaps the best value during our 2 weeks in Australia; the 1/2 rack of lamb ribs and salmon skewer at the Meat & Wine Restaurant were ample portions and absolutely delicious - both went well with the 2 glasses of house red that were free with the card given us by the concierge when he made our reservation. Prior to the Holiday Inn we stayed 4 nites, starting March 24th for $220/nite at the Crowne Plaza Darling Harbour and feel the Holiday Inn to be the better value.

Reviews.Title: “100% No Smoking Hotel - This should be advised when booking”
Reviews.Author: sstuff3
Reviews.Content: The entire hotel is non-smoking and they do not offer any smoking rooms which leads to everyone gathering in front of the main entrance at all hours of the day and night to smoke. On the plus side, the rooms are clean and the maid staff very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Well located, reasonable hotel”
Reviews.Author: fivelaws
Reviews.Content: A reasonably well located hotel in the Chinatown area of Sydney, a scenic short stroll away from Darling Harbour, almost across the road from Paddyâ€™s Markets and a refreshingly long (1Â½ mile) Sunday walk away from the Harbour Bridge & Opera House. I spent 13-nights in room 810, with an uninspiring view towards Haymarket. The room was quiet, reasonably large with a nice clean, comfy bed. Lighting was a bit gloomy and the now old-fashioned looking TV (not flat screen) had a reasonable mix of channels. The bathroom was a little cramped, with a full-sized bath and combined shower with one of those horrible cloth shower screens that get sucked towards the water and stick to you. The only thing I really disliked was the laughably expensive internet access - $0.55/minute - $27.50/day. The McDonald's opposite has free WiFi and there is a cyber Cafe in Harbourside (Darling Harbour) that charges $1 for 20 mins. As a comparison, the roadside motel in the Blue Mountains I spent a few days at offered free high-speed WiFi in all rooms included in the price. As soon as these hotels realise that internet access in hotels is now considered as normal as hot water, televisions and electricity the better. All in all â€“ perfectly acceptable base to explore Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money in an expensive city”
Reviews.Author: katb82
Reviews.Content: As other reviews have stated, this hotel is more in Chinatown than Darling Harbour, however with Darling Harbour less than 10 minutes walk (and a very scenic walk at that) away, we didn't find it an issue. Check in was efficient but not overly friendly. The lobby/bar of the hotel is very pleasant and well presented, open plan and welcoming. Our room was on the 4th floor, but not on the same side as the monorail track. My partner said he could faintly hear the monorail going past at night, but I could not. We could not hear any noise in the corridor. The room was well presented and the bed very comfortable. My only complaint would be the shower over the bath - as I am quite short it was hard getting in and out with tired legs! We did not eat in the restaurant, but ate one bar meal which was nice, drinks were very reasonably priced and staff were friendly. The outdoor area was a great place to have a cold drink on a hot day. We did the walk to Sydney Harbour on a very warm day, I would estimate it is about 30 minutes walk each way, but we didn't walk the shortest route - the walk itself is quite easy but in 30+ degrees the walk back was not very pleasant! In room internet was quite expensive ($27.50 per day with a download limit). Overall we enjoyed our two nights at Holiday Inn Darling Harbour. If we return to Sydney we may stay here again but may look for somewhere else in a slightly different location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service!”
Reviews.Author: kaztin
Reviews.Content: You usually know what to expect with a big chain like Holiday Inn, and this does exactly what it says â€œon the tinâ€�, so to speak. The location is really handy. Of course, the views arenâ€™t of the harbour, but that would have blown our budget. An easy stroll for 5-10mins took you into the heart of Darling Harbour. There is also a monorail station at China town less than 5 mins away that you can get an all day pass for $9.95 and hop on and off all day which loops all the central bit and Darling Harbour. So it was a really handy location. On to the hotel itself.... we were in the new bit on the 10th floor, so I canâ€™t speak for the lower older part. Our room was clean, bright and airy, all the usual things you would expect to be provided with (except no free biscuits to accompany the tea & coffee making bits and bobs...) but it did not disappoint and the bed was comfy too! The staff were really friendly and helpful and brekkie was yummy. It was a bit chilly in the restaurant (too much aircon!), but wear layers and you will be fine. I would absolutely return there and thoroughly enjoyed our 4 night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very Average”
Reviews.Author: fosschuck
Reviews.Content: For the price $245 a night this place is way below average and dated. Thankfully it was for one night only. Breakfast was again very average and dreadful coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sarah_from_the_uk
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel end of Feb 2010 in one of the executive rooms. These rooms are spacious, mod cons (inc Flat screen tv), rooms are contemporary designed and clean, bright and airy. I stayed on the 8th Floor (floors 8-11) is part of the new extension. However, i did notice on Floor 7 that the rooms were old fashioned and needed a makeover. The staff are friendly, i even arrived at the hotel prior to 2pm and they allowed me to check in early (fantastic after a 27 hr flight). The hotel is clean, busy and staff are helpful, friendly and professional. The only downside was that the air con in the breakfast restaurant was too cold and as a result of this your hot food cools rather quickly and you may need a cardigan or pullover to avoid the goose pimples. The food overall was delicious and the staff were fantastic (attending to your every need and the self service buffet was replenished frequently). Fantastic hotel - will definately stay again. Perfect location. England, UK

Reviews.Title: “great hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: Lou_and_Paul
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here previously so knew what to expect. The location is great right next to Chinatown so access to food and entertainment is very good. We stayed in room 931 which ironically someone else has already added photos of and they are accurate. Room was ready and very clean when arrived. The hotel is in the middle of some one way streets so if it is your first time there and you are driving you may do a couple of 'blockies' to find the front door. I had to check my e-tag later on in the evening and the conseirage offered for me to use his computer rather than go up to the business centre - which was very nice. Breakfast was good which was included in the room rate that I had booked. My daughter follows a strict gluten free diet (Coeliac Disease) and I asked the waiter if they had any gluten free bread which they did and the staff organised for some GF toast. I am sure if I had more time they would have made up some GF french toast (which was available in the buffet). When we checked out we left the car in the valet parking until 3pm which was cheaper than moving to the entertainment centre car park across the road. Lovely walk across the road through the Darling Harbour complex. This is a totally non-smoking hotel and I love this fact that your room does not smell like smoke and there are no ashtrays around the entrance so there are no loiterers who you have to walk through to get into the hotel. I would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, safe, clean hotel with spacious rooms next to Chinatown and Darling Harbour”
Reviews.Author: nnsanci
Reviews.Content: I stayed there on my first trip to Sydney -- a great choice. It is very close to Darling Harbour and basically in the middle of Chinatown. We paid about 119 AUD/night, which I thought was very reasonable for Sydney. The double room we had was very spacious, with a minibar. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel--would recommend”
Reviews.Author: Teddall
Reviews.Content: Good location. Refitted bright room and bathroom. Felt really at home. Close to darling Harbour attractions and Chinatown Would I stay again--absolutely

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but”
Reviews.Author: Dillboy
Reviews.Content: You need to valet your car because the there is NO PARKING, I was able to negotiate a good rate because I was there for a week. Told him no after he told me the price and he gave me a better rate. Getting to the hotel is very difficult without GPS or a second person reading a map. The room was non-smoking which means I had a 6am walk to the front door, where there are NO ASHTRAYS anywhere. The windows in the room DO NOT OPEN and there is no FREE INTERNET ACCESS in the business center. The sauna could use a fix up as the door does not stay closed. Room was ok but who ever painted it does not know how to paint. The door needs to be cleaned as well as the mirrors. See pictures

Reviews.Title: “value for money”
Reviews.Author: robertajaneSydney
Reviews.Content: Clean,safe hotel with helpful staff. Rooms are not luxurious but are perfectly adequate for most travellers. I paid $119 a night and feel the hotel was good value for money. Location is great- close to Paddy's Markets, Chinatown, Darling Harbour and main city shopping areas.

Reviews.Title: “We really enjoyed this hotel”
Reviews.Author: grassgrub
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for two nights direct on internet.We had been down in Southern New South Wales and drove from 130 kms south of Wagga Wagga in a day so was pretty exhausted with Sydney Traffic and the Hume Highway on arrival.. Checked in (no problems.Went straight to the bar the steward was a delight and as we say in the country should be cloned.His name was Eric and he was from Hong Kong.All staff we came across in the hotel were superb.The room was tops.He was truly a delight not often found in a big city hotel.We used the monorail over to Darling Harbour and the tram to the Casino whish was a highly profitable experiencee

Reviews.Title: “Typical Old Style Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: donsyb
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights over NYE using Priority CLub points. We arrived at 8am and our room wasn't ready until nearly 3pm. We did get some free drinks vouchers for while we waited. However on check in we were pleased to find we had been uograded to a suite, which explained the delay (partner is platinum level priority club). There was a lounge with sofa, TV, desk, armchair, dining table and fridge. Separate bedroom with another TV, and large bathroom with separate bath and shower. The room was quite old and in need of refurb, particularly the bathroom - this is a HI not yet rebranded. Location is good, but not really in DH - more Chinatown/ Haymarket. Handy for cheap food and the market. Another nice touch was on New Years Eve - we came back late afternoon to find a bottle of bubbly and strawberries waiting for us! Breakfast was ok, but a bit pricey for what it is.

Reviews.Title: “Tired - needs some TLC”
Reviews.Author: Freqtravellerperth
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the HI Darling Harbour for a conference prior to an international holiday. While the location is convenient for Darling Harbour and the Sydney Convention Centre, the hotel is very tired and in need of refurbishment. Lots of ordinary features and ordinary service.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SoCaliforniaSteve
Reviews.Content: I recently completed a 4-night stay at the Holiday Inn at Darling Harbor. This was a last-minute decision, and I found an inexpensive nightly rate on-line if I was willing to make FULL payment in advance with no refund for cancellation. I took advantage of this opportunity. The hotel far exceeded my expectations. It's in a wonderful location - close to the great Chinatown restaurants and fun shopping at Paddy's Market as well as George Street and the CBD of Sydney. Best of all, it's a pleasant walk of less than ten minutes to all the eateries, shopping and sightseeing at Darling Harbor. Other points of interest such as The Rocks, Circular Quay and the Opera House involve an easy walk. There are also city bus lines on George Street you can take. I was quite appalled reading some of the previous reviews of this fine hotel. For those who are offended having to walk through the small coin-operated guest laundry room to reach the gym/spa, then perhaps you need to pay hundreds of dollars more per night and stay in some luxury five-star hotel elsewhere. The one and only point I will comment on...I was on the 11th floor, so I had no trouble regarding the noise from the monorail running directly in front of the hotel - practically right outside the room windows on the second and third floors. But upon observation from outside, I found that would be a bit annoying if I did have a room at that particular level. I would highly recommend this hotel and definitely look forward to staying there again on my next visit "down under." Just make certain you ask for a room on a high level, or you'll have the monorail riders watching you getting dressed or sleeping.

Reviews.Title: “UNPROFESSIONAL”
Reviews.Author: ylbuckwheat
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this location twice. First while in Sydney, at which the staff was not very helpful or friendly. Secoind, on our way back from Auckland enroute home to Hawaii. This second visit was a nightmare. On the morning we were leaving, there was a large tour group in for breakfast. The wait was 1 hour long, and almost no food left on the buffet. We were repeatedly asked to vacate the rooms, with no communication from management. Unprofessional is the nicest way I can put it.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel if you get a good price.”
Reviews.Author: rbbrooks
Reviews.Content: This was a pretty unexciting hotel. The room was clean, check in was ok but they forgot to give me the free drink cards i was entitled to, (this was rectified when i returned to the desk later). The parking is not overly convenient but given the location of the hotel this is understandable. Bar service was OK, didn't try the restaurant. Would stay again at the right price.

Reviews.Title: “Stay clear of Holiday Inn Darling Harbour”
Reviews.Author: khaophad
Reviews.Content: My wife and I started our Australia trip by staying here. We started looking for hotels only one week prior, and chose the Holiday Inn based on its relative price (which was still fairly expensive, but that is Sydney), location, and star rating. We booked a superior room using Priceline. Upon checking in we were told that due to the room type and using a 3rd party booking website, we were not guaranteed a room with a single bed. At the time only rooms with two twin beds were available, so we accepted that hoping to only stay one night. The receptionist was kind enough to let us check in early in the morning since the room was cleaned and available. We ended up staying for our entire reservation due to the hassle of trying to cancel using priceline, and having to pack and move our items. The hallways in the hotel smell very musty and look like they had water damage on the carpeting. We thought this might just be our floor, but after visiting multiple floors the smell was everywhere. The room also had a musty odor, but not as strong as the hallways thankfully. The room we had was clean, but the twin beds are very uncomfortable. You can feel the springs when you move around, and our backs hurt every morning. The pillows were thin (not good if you are a side sleeper). We wished the windows would open to get some fresh air. We like going to the gym while on vacation, having a gym was one of the reasons we chose this hotel. Getting to the gym is a little strange as you have to pass through the laundry room. At the time, the gym's jacuzzi and sauna were out of order. Then the main fitness area is a small area consisting of 1 LifeFitness machine, 1 bike, 1 treadmill, and 1 elliptical. It's like a nice home gym rather than a gym you'd think to find at a hotel. The location was nice being close to Chinatown that has good eats like Mamak or Spice I Am. It's about 10 minute walk to CityRail stations of Central and Town Hall. I thought being near the monorail station would be great for getting around town, but we found the monorail didn't go near any of the places we wanted to visit. When researching this hotel I thought this hotel was a 4-star hotel based on what most sites had listed it as (one site did have it as a 3-star). This hotel didn't feel like a 4-star hotel. If you need wifi, one nice thing is that you can reach the McDonald's wifi from the hotel lobby and restaurant. But the connection gets really slow and has a lot of errors during peak hours. The hotel wifi has an expensive rate, so we never tried it. The day prior to checking out I asked the concierge what the best way to the get to the airport was and he mentioned there is a bus that comes every 30 minutes at specific times, and costs $14 per person. What he failed to mention was that for two people, the cost of taking a taxi is about $30. And he didn't mention that the bus was an independent party that makes lots of stops at other hotels, so its nowhere near as fast as taking a taxi.

Reviews.Title: “I will stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Wolin
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Holiday Inn Darling Harbour because it was close to my business meeting location. I was upgraded for free. The room was a good size, clean and comfortable; it had two free bottles of water, a big flat screen TV, bathrobes and a comfy bed with lots of pillows. The bathroom was big and boasted both a bath and shower. The $18 breakfast special was very nice and good value. Great location; across the road from the Entertainment Centre and close to China Town and Central Station. I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Service, Bad experience”
Reviews.Author: TimMelbourne
Reviews.Content: Got to the hotel. Issues with check-in. Then issues with the toilet in my room. Then issues with the TV, fridge and poor lighting in the next one.. Maybe it was the 5 times it took me to remind the staff to fix the problem. Did I mention the doors are hard to open? I was told there's a 'knack' to it. I don't know about you, but when I am tired and just want to go into my room, don't want to stand outside the door trying to 'get it' for 2 minutes. Breakfast - just walk on in and have an undecipherable reception followed by the room invoice thrust under your nose because the young asian chap cannot be understood; and rudely hurries you up. I have stayed in many hotels around Australia and overseas, and this one, run by inept staff on this occasion is probably the worst example of hospitality professionalism I've come across for the reputation involved.

Reviews.Title: “BAD BAD BAD”
Reviews.Author: NeecyNewcastle
Reviews.Content: A resonably priced place to stay however we stayed on Grand Final weekend when they were buys and it was quite apparent that the staff couldnt cope. After having gifts delivered (it was a special occasion) they were not delivered to our room when there was a specific request to do so we had to lug a box to our room on our own... So much for the surprise. The room we booked was a queen however we were put into a triple ( 3 single beds) not ideal for a romantic weekend away. When we complained the duty manager was indifferent and the staff on the desk were also indifferent and obnoxious. My advice \;ok to stay if you are on business definately do not stay if you are a couple and are looking for something special. Quite disappointed i expected so much better from such a chain.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Chinatown location just south of downtown”
Reviews.Author: DisneyParis
Reviews.Content: Dates of Stay: 2 nights 6-8 September 2009 in Room 931 and 1 night 11-12 September 2009 in Room 1027. Both rooms had 2 very comfortable beds with duvets and many pillows to choose from (plus a pillow menu if others were needed). There were ample outlets by beds and at desk with computer access (US and European plugs by computer desk). I did not have my laptop so no idea how well this worked. Phone with built-in alarm clock-could set time but not activate?? No directions and not obvious how to do. Power connection to back of phone came off very easily-be careful or won't work but there is another phone by the computer outlet. There were 3 bedside tables-one on each side plus one in between two beds where phone/alarm clock were located. This extra space was nice to have. Each room had kettle with coffee/tea supplies provided but no dry creamer-liquid creamer in refrigerator. Minibar items seemed expensive so none used-bought soft drinks down the street and put in fridge to chill. Bought chips twice the size for half the price at 7-11 on Sussex St (one block over). There were 2 complimentary water bottles which were restocked on the 2 night stay. Brochures about Sydney as well as stationery and pen provided by computer desk. Luggage rack-as well as closet with hangers, shelves, iron/ironing board, extra pillows, blankets, and safe (prior guest had left safe in locked position in first room with door open-manager came and reset promptly when called). Mirrored closet door was good since only mirror not in bathroom area. Bathroom had tub, separate shower, sink, and toilet. Room 931 had mold/mildew issue in two drains. They cleaned the one in the middle of bathroom but never cleaned the one in shower even after second request-had to take off cover and put plastic bag over when not using to keep sewer/musty odor from permeating the room. Room 1027 was a corner room and had a slightly different layout but the same furniture (and no bad smells). Room 931 had nothing spectacular to see from room-just other buildings but nothing scenic, but room 1027 had views of Darling Harbour, the ANZAC bridge, and the southern part of the city centre due to windows on two sides of the room. One set of the thicker curtains seemed to be lacking a little but thinner curtain kept out the glare. Had the room faced east, sunrise may have been too bright! Sunset was! Everything was spotless in both rooms except the drains in the room 931. Breakfast included in rate was plentiful. They made eggs to order for me and had tasty Canadian bacon and crispy sliced bacon. Many juices, hash browns, breads, and a juicer as well as coffee/tea and more. One item on the buffet that I really enjoyed was the sauteed Portabella (sp?) mushrooms. It provided a great start to the day! Since we were returning for a 2nd stay 3 days after our first, we each left one bag (dirty clothes, Sydney travel info, wine we couldn't take on plane to Cairns, etc.) at hotel with concierge baggage check. Upon our return, everything was there and untouched and undamaged. They offered to deliver to our room, but we bumped into the guy getting on the elevator on the floor where the storage room was and took them from there. All the concierge staff as well as those at the front desk and in the restaurant (breakfast only for us) were friendly and professional. Great customer service! In summary, I give our first stay a 3.5 due to the musty smell and the lack of response to cleaning the shower drain after a verbal and a written request. I give the second stay a 4.5 since almost everything was perfect. Join the priority club ( and pay the $50 to upgrade to Gold level if you aren't Gold already). I was upgraded on both stays due to my status and felt extra special the way they treated me and my friend. I would definitely check out this hotel for a future trip to Sydney!

Reviews.Title: “nice-ish hotel. Just o.k really.”
Reviews.Author: Pinklou80
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights on our tour of oz. Initially we had booked 2 nights at an internet dicount rate but we realised we needed an extra night there so had to ring up and book another. The extra night costed a little more because it wasnt the 'internet' rate but we werent too bothered. The hotel itself is situated about a 10 minute walk from darling harbour, not far from china town. We were welcomed by a friendly japaneese staff member who gave us a room on the third floor. However, when we got into our room I was less than happy. It was very very basic and gloomy looking. For some unknown reason we had been given a disabled access room, therefore there was no bath. The room was very dowdy and dark and I felt a little let down so I decided to ask to change rooms. I spoke to a lovely woman at reception and explained my unhappiness. She was very understanding and offered me a room on the first floor to look at. A very helpful concierge man showed me the room which he explained was 'situated next to the cities monorail', therefore, 'might be slightly noisy'. However, I stood and listened to the monorail go past and to be honest I felt it could barely be heard, therefore I accepted the room change. The new room was much more spacious and comfortable- plus a little lighter. However, the windows looked like they hadnt been cleaned in 10 years and we couldnt open our curtains as our room looked out directly onto the street. I figured that this was the best we were going to get so we settled. When I went back to reception to get our new room keys the original japaneese staff member was there again, so I explained what we were doing. He seemed less than impressed with me and his previous friendly persona dissapeared as he handed me the new keys without a smile. I felt a bit like I had personally offended him! At the end of the day...when you are paying alot of money to stay somewhere you have to feel happy. I wasn't expecting the hilton but i was expecting more than what we originally got! The hotel has a small gym with a runner, cross trainer and bike as well as a few weights. I used it once and found it very pleasant. There is also a very small spa which we never got round to using. The only downfall is that the gym and spa is located through the laundry room on the third floor so you feel a little claustraphobic in there. On our last day the concierge staff looked after us by taking care of our bags whilst waiting for the airport transfer. I also ventured into the hotel bar/restaurant to ask if they could russle me up a strawberry milkshake (even though it wasnt on the menu) The guys behind the bar were wonderful, very friendly and a little eccentric! They made me the MOST wonderful milkshake, complete with real strawberries. I thought this was a lovely touch and just wished that the whole hotel made me smile as much as these particular staff. All in all, I probably wouldn't stay here again...I'm sure we could have found somewhere better for the same price. A shame really, because the hotel actually has a lot of potential....it just needs a makeover.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and refurbished rooms”
Reviews.Author: monoz
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Holiday Inn Darling Harbour, to my surpirse I found the staff great and the rooms better than average. I had a corner room very quite very spacious, nice new flat screen tv, sofa, business desk. Above avergae, good location, not far from everywhere in the cbd really. Get the monorail out the front. Can't go wrong at this hotel... Only thing holiday inn drop your internet prices please... More business people would use it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: Huskador
Reviews.Content: This hotel is about a 5 min walk from Darling Harbour itself, meaning you have easy access to the bars and restaurants on the harbour. It is a great place to see the city from as Darling Harbour has regular ferry trips to circular quay etc and its also on the monorail loop. Its about a ten min walk from the train station and internet cafes and is practically next door to Paddy's Market which is great for shopping. The hotel is very clean and the superior Queen bedroom we had was very spacious and comfortable, it provided an excellent base for our 4 night stay. the only complaint I had was that we were given the wrong room on arrival (a twin) and I was extremely jet lagged so that didn't go down too well! A manager sorted the problem within 10 mins. I would definitely stay here again if I go back to Sydney!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: VanessaNarotam
Reviews.Content: My husband and two children, aged 6 and 2 and I stayed here for 4 nts in June 2009. Breakfast was not included, and was exorbitantly priced for a minimal selection, AUD$15. The room was decently sized and the staff were helpful. It is conveniently situated, with easy access to George Street, Market CIty, and Darling Harbour - all within 5-8mins walk.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for concert at ent centre and close to darling harbour”
Reviews.Author: soo_what
Reviews.Content: Great location if you need to attend something at ent centre or darling harbour. Easy walk from central station or lightrail stops outside paddy's market. Close to darling harbour, sydney ent centre, paddys market, and lightrail and monorail. Limited hotel parking but parking available at sydney ent centre parking. Pretty fast check in recepition busy due to concert over the road. Room was comfortable very comfortable bed. Room service or eating down stairs.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean, but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: gorgeousles
Reviews.Content: No particular problems, just a generic Holiday Inn. Prices reflect the Darling Harbour location, but in fact the hotel sits a bit back from the actual harbour, so the view isn't that great.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location, expensive breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Harry_Singh
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn at Darling Harbour was a great place to finish up our honeymoon in Australia. The room was big and clean. The bathroom was medium sized, but very clean. The staff was nice. No problems at this hotel. The breakfast was nothing special, bread, cereals, etc. for 25 AUD which I thought was very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “One of the worse Holidays Inns”
Reviews.Author: Lanosia
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 3 nights. In the airport shuttle on my way to the hotel, one guy told me it is the worse hotel in Sydney, I thought he was just joking. However, after staying for 3 nights, I see his point. In day 1: there are no slippers in the room, and I have to ask the staff got get them. Day 2: no towels in the bathroom, and the new bed sheet has some blood like stains on it. I have to ask again to get them replaced. After two nights, I l flew to another city, and come back 3 days later, so on Day 3: my new room is on the 3rd floor, which just right above the mono rail outside the street. I can hear train rumbling by. Worse yet, I found that there is a door that leads to the room next to us, and it is unlocked! When I am checking the door, I accidentally opened it and have to say "Hi" to my unexpected neighbor. I was very angry and call the front desk to express my displeasure. They are kind enough to upgrade me a suite for the night. However, given the experience I had, I will not come back again. There are better hotels in Sydney that have lower price.
