The only good thing I found about this hotel is the location. It is next to the mono rail, and tram, plus it is right at the Chinatown if you want some decent Chinese. The walk to the Central Station is about 15 minutes if you don't want to take the tram.

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff but dated rooms.”
Reviews.Author: wbatt
Reviews.Content: We arrived early (8:30 am) and the staff found us a room right away. The room was a bit of a disappointment. Burn holes in the carpet and the room needed to be repainted. The staff during our stay was great and the location was just a short walk to Darling harbor. Hotel is overrated in some surveys and should be rated as a 2 Star and no higher.

Reviews.Title: “Didnt deliver customer service expected at this level”
Reviews.Author: groundy
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Holiday Inn, May, 2009. Our room was very neat, tidy and clean, with a reasonable view. The heating was extremely hot, even when I turned down the setting to nil. The closure of JBâ€™s for breakfast, - there was confusion on where we could have our breakfast. We were given the wrong information and waited around 40 minutes for it to open only to find out we should have gone to Shipleys instead. The first morning we were greeted with good service, but because there was confusion on what we were entitled to for breakfast, the service went down hill from then on. The person in charge was very rude, but on our last morning there attitude had changed a little. I was disappointed because it was meant to be a special holiday celebrating our wedding anniversary.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NSS27
Reviews.Content: Sydney, NSW : The Holiday Inn Darling Harbour. Date : 31st March,2009 I stayed at this hotel with my family for 3 nights. The hotel was very good. All the standard amenities of a star hotel. Very spacious rooms, well equipped bathrooms, safe, tea-coffee maker etc. One drawback in the room though, insufficient lighting. They can definitely add more lights. Besides that, very friendly & helpful hotel staff. Great food in their restaurants. The breakfast spread was quite lavish too. But the best of all is the location. Walking distance to Darling Harbour, Chinatown, George Street, Pitt Street. If you don't like walking too much, even the monorail station is just a stones throw away. All in all, great hotel, good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: sandra57Sydney
Reviews.Content: We took advantage of a very special deal for $AUD99 per night when Holiday Inn advertised a 72 hour only sale on the internet. Upon arrival we were upgraded to the new wing of the hotel where we spent 2 nights over the Easter break. Check in was fast, friendly and efficient. Our room was clean, modern and comfortable. The staff were friendly and helfpul. The buffet breakfast was at a special price of $15 per person. Excellent value. The staff did a great job at an extremely busy time. We would definitely stay here again when in town even knowing that we may not get such a fantastic deal again. A short walk to Darling Harbour where you will find lots of restaurants. Nick's Seafood restaurant was excellent but cheaper options are all around if you don't want to spend a lot of money.

Reviews.Title: “just value for money....”
Reviews.Author: ArunB
Reviews.Content: the hotel is very centrally located ....at the darling harbour.... very close to many attractions and public transports.... nice enough for all kind of people.....the rooms are quite comfortable....

Reviews.Title: “Very nice location !”
Reviews.Author: Bobbykat
Reviews.Content: The hotels location was very handy; Paddy's Market and Chinatown right round the corner, Darling Harbour, the railway station and shopping street within walking distance. Hotel was very clean and tidy and the laundry room easy to use. The monorail "train" operated right from infront of our 3rd floor window but didn't bother us the least bit. Breakfast can be enjoyed wither at the hotel or nearby cafÃ© and there's even a McDonald's across the street. If you rent a car in Sydney you can park it across the street at a parking clomplex. We liked it and can recommend it !

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: jax11ard
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night here.The location is fantastic,right next to China town,a 5 minute walk to Darling Harbour,20 minute walk to the OPera House etc,superb.Check in was speedy and efficient ( not like Holiday Inns in the UK!).The room was huge and spotlessly clean.The hotel is a 15 minute walk to Central Station.Highly recommended for a city hotel and reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “decent choice”
Reviews.Author: skytrack
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the holiday inn for 2 nights from 17th to 19th Feb 2009. Id booked the room via the hotel website and after checking with various other sources, am convinced we got a good deal. We paid AUD 161 per night for a twin standard room including breakfast and taxes. Pretty good rate for a hotel thats so centrally located. Our flight into Sydney arrived at 7.15 AM and we were at the hotel front desk by 9.15. Although I had made a special request for an early check in while reserving the room, I had half expected my request to be complied with. Much to our relief, we were immediately given a room. Maybe because the hotel was around 70% occupied at the time. The room required some effort getting into. The key card needs to be swiped in a particular fashion and the door handle needs to be pressed down simultaenously. SOmething I hadnt experienced before. Nothing great about the room. That said, nothing to fault either. The two single beds were adequately sized, clean and comfortable. The room was clean. The bathroom satisfactory. As many of earlier reviews have said, the location of the hotel is superb. I agree. 1 mins walk to the Haymarket shopping center and a further few minutes walk from the China Town area. The breakfast was the standard fare comprising of cold cuts, cereal, assorted breads, juices, and common hot dishes like scrambled eggs, baked beans, bacon, mushrooms, hash browns. We didnt eat our meals in the restaurant, but did take in a few brews at the inhouse bar, JBs. They had a good collection of the local stuff. The hotel didnt make me drop my jaw and go wow, but it is completely satisfactory in all aspects.

Reviews.Title: “great location but disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: HelenaPTan
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Sydney on my way back from a business trip in Brisbane and was very disappointed with several aspects of my stay. My intention was to have a nice relaxing weekend. I was on a break and ordered wine after midnight. The uninformed night manager was not aware of the licensing laws- she said it was not possible. Considering this was not on any of the material within the room (not on the room service menu for example) I find this completely unacceptable. Then on the Sunday I wanted to watch one of their advertised movies which was I was told unavailable to my room and they could look into it the next day. After being given a code to use wireless internet which did not work I was also told that some rooms do not have access to wireless. In addition when blowdrying my hair two different blow dryers did not work and they had to inform me that the socket in the bathroom was falty. This would not be such a disappointment if the price of the hotel was not as high as it is. The next time I am in Sydney I will not be staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great place exept for the internet price”
Reviews.Author: umanitek
Reviews.Content: This is your standard nice reliable holiday inn, recently upgraded and centraly located, wlking distance to oxford street, circular quay and the opera house, but thy charge 27 aus dollars a day for the internet, even thought the web site says free, ya free if u pay $100 more a day for your room, what a joke!, beware! ALL Holiday inns in Sydney charge this same amount, but in smaller towns and in most american ones it is FREE Other then that , the place is great.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: geoffel
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff were very helpful and location is good for Darling Harbour attractions but hotel is a little rundown looking. Restaurant is very pricey. Do visit the Chinese Gardens only a 3 minute walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for attending convention center”
Reviews.Author: adventureperth
Reviews.Content: We had to attend the conference at convention center and so we chose this Hotel for its proximity. Location was great, we hadn't realised how close to china town we were. It was excellent all the food and shops open till 8.00 p.m. Having been there for chinese new year was added bonus. The key card which has to be used to get to your floor was a nice security touch. We had breakfast included, the great thing was the juicer which u could use to do your own, down side was b/fast everyday was the same thing, no variation in cooked or cold b/fast menu. Fitness center was quite small, but I guess at least they did have one, I also used the steam room! They were two bottle of complementary water, every day which was great. There was a pillow menu, but whatever I asked for , they had run out!!! I did have a bit of neck pain when I got back but nevemind. Our room was a family room with two double bed / cramped, but kind of expected it! expensive valet parking $35.00 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Fleasky
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in May 2008 while visiting friends and family. The location is wonderful if you are looking to be in the heart of Sydney. The room was clean and roomy. The bathroom included a tub and walk in shower. Our only complaint was the monorail running by what seemed like just an arm's length from our window on the second floor (if I recall). When we opened the curtains in the morning, commuters could look right in! I would stay here again, but request a room on a different floor.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem in the heart of Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Curlisue
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent two nights at this hotel recently over a Friday and Saturday night. The location of this hotel is superb, in that, it is centrally located in Chinatown and therefore close to a variety of restaurants, Paddyâ€™s markets, Central train station â€“ a 10 minute walk, the monorail, Darling Harbour and the George Street shops. It is the location alone which makes this hotel an attractive option for accommodation in central Sydney. Check in was swift and very courteous. The room itself was located on the ninth and non-smoking floor. Upon entering the room it was clean and tidy, contained a queen sized bed which was very comfortable, a single lounge chair, desk and TV cabinet. The room also had tea and coffee facilities and a bar fridge. The bathroom was clean, the shower pressure very good and everything in good working order. However, it was difficult for two people to stand in; my husband and I are slim people, so I considered the bathroom reasonably small. A small tip is when using the elevator that you must slide your room card through the slot to enable access to your allocated floor. This happened quite a lot to a few people we met and can be a trap for beginners! JBs bar is downstairs and has a nice atmosphere for a drink after a long day. We didnâ€™t dine in the restaurant, therefore unsure of the standard of service. All staff were courteous and friendly. If driving to Sydney parking is available at the Chinatown Parking lot close to the hotel. The concierge will provide you with a ticket and costs approximately $15.00 per day.

Reviews.Title: “Functional, excellent value”
Reviews.Author: gabes80
Reviews.Content: It does its job as a HI/4 star property - with a pretty good location closer to Chinatown (thus we had yum cha for breakfast!) and the monorail stop nearby. Quite a few attractions within walking distance. Our room was a triple room - with 3 singles beds, of a good size. The TV was dated, and the bathroom appeared dated but no other qualms. Couldn't find an accessible powerpoint near the desk though! Service was excellent, and for our caffeine fix - both the restaurant and the bar did very good lattes - soy at no discernible extra charge! Check in and check out was speedy and efficient, no attempt to flog unnecessary products. As I obtained the room rate in the most recent Priority Club sale, it was indeed excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Well Pleased Stay”
Reviews.Author: Carte_Blanche888
Reviews.Content: Best part of this hotel is that its steps away from the monorail stn, the paddys market and 15 min walk from the central station. The rooms are fairly good (the bed could have been better though) and the service and reception are quite nice. We enjoyed drinks and food at its restaurant and strongly recommend them. V good value for money and a good choice for both business and leisure travelers.

Reviews.Title: “5 Minutes to Darling Harbour”
Reviews.Author: Elaine D
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights on way to New Zealand, so time was limited. Hotel was excellent facilities for stopover, 5 minutes walk to Darling Harbour, Breakfast was good value, would thoroughly recommend this hotel. Mini Bar was very expensive!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location: not so great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Asil00
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location: chinatown, paddys market, darling harbour, cbd - all nearby. However, was disappointed as I had booked for 2 ad & 1 ch, but was only provided 1 dbl bed. When asked for bed for child, was told it would be an extra $55 per night. Be careful when booking - make sure you have the right bedding. Their claim that kids "stay & eat for free" did not ring true as you have to pay extra for kids bed! There are no views to speak of and we were on the top floor (11th). Toilet would leak 5 mins after every flush so you would have to bang the button to get it to stop. Hmmmm, wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Look Elsewhere! Many better options”
Reviews.Author: dhtchk
Reviews.Content: We first stayed in Sydney at the start of our visit to Australia at the Rendezvous Hotel, in the historic district and thoroughly enjoyed it. Great location, clean, bright, well appointed rooms. We thought when we returned for a night prior to our flight out, we'd try another hotel, so we booked one night at the Holiday Inn Darling Harbour. What a disappointment across the board! Even my kids were depressed by the state of this hotel, with its dark, dingy hallways. The supposed workout room and "hot tub" was enough to make you feel ill just walking into it, which you had to do through the filthy laundry room. The rooms themselves are well appointed, though the funky light system using the key card was annoying. However, the windows allow little or no light and the schlept through the odd lobby, hotel and hallways made it sad experience. Had we been planning to stay more than one night, we would have definitely changed hotels. The key card for everything made us feel like we were in a lock down facility and that the neighborhood was really questionable. Pay the extra money and stay in The Rocks area.

Reviews.Title: “great location small rooms”
Reviews.Author: maddiwm
Reviews.Content: Great location, very close to the iner city. Options of walking or on occaions caught the Monorail which goes round in a loop and stops at various places in the city centre. Rooms are smallish, but very clean and helpful staff. In all, not necessary the best ever hotel but good for it's offerings and price.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfiying Stay”
Reviews.Author: highdesertbadger
Reviews.Content: I recently spent 3 nights at the Darling Harbour Holiday Inn and my experience was quite good. After a long 15 flight from San Francisco I was able to check in at 9:30 in the morning giving me time too freshen up and get in a full day of sight seeing. The rooms are on the smallish side, but this is the norm for a big city property. The rooms was very clean, quiet and as others have said the location is wonderful. There are plenty of places to eat nearby and attractions are also very accessible. I have no problem recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: dalda
Reviews.Content: The most useful feature of this hotel is its central location. It's less than a 5 minute walk to great eateries in Chinatown, Paddy's market and the Monorail station. Through Monorail, Darling Harbour and Sydney CBD are easily accessible. Note that Circular Quay / Harbour Bridge / Opera House still require either a 15 minute walk or 5 minute cab ride (<$10) after using the Monorail. The monorail goes right next to the hotel so the lower floors (2-3) might not get that much privacy. The hotel is clean and has all the basic amenities. Internet comes at a pretty hefty price though. There are no detailed phone tariffs posted in the rooms (this seems to be the norm in Australia) and the front desk receptionist was pretty hazy when I called up (local calls are a dollar I think, toll free should be free except for some numbers blah blah)....I was keeping my fingers crossed till I checked out........it turned out not so bad in the end (toll free calls were free; local calls were 1 dollar per call)

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable”
Reviews.Author: CherryPuppy
Reviews.Content: A convenient location on the Chinatown side of Darling Harbour, particularly if need to be in the area. Check-in was average. I stood at the demarcated location for Priority Club members, and was asked by a somewhat irritated reception staff whether I was a member and I replied in an equally irritated and sarcastic manner which resulted in a change of attitude. I was in the "new" part of the hotel, and the room layout is a bit strange - its very narrow and long with the bed stretching across the width of the room. A peculiar layout and not the best use of space. Otherwise room was fine, clean with all necessary essentials. Around a 10-15 minute walk will take you into the heart of the Darling Harbour action. The same amount of time will take you into the heart of the city. A monorail station is close by, Paddy's Market is across the road, and a range of eating options are close by, since you are in Chinatown. Not the best value for money as such, but acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: SusieMc65
Reviews.Content: What an excellent hotel in a great location! This is a holiday inn though so don't expect the sheraton, however... This hotel is in a perfect location for a visit to Sydney. Located in china town, a 1 minute walk to Paddys market and a 1.5 minute walk to a monorail station. Easy walk and access to Darling Harbour. If you want to go to Cricular Quay it is a bit tricky, but pretty much you just catch a bus straight down george street. Or alternatively, walk to Central and catch a train from there. Fantastic restaurant on Golbourn street, Mamak. Satay and Roti restauant. Cheap and the best satays I have had outside Malaysia. An absolute definite must eat here restaurant, and cheap too! As for the hotel itself. We stayed in an executive room on the 10th floor and for 2 adults and 2 kids it was pretty good value. The kids loved the foxtel! The rooms are a good size and the bathroom is great with a seperate bath and shower. They need to look at adding a micowave into the kitcheny area they have as this would add to the room. We had a room facing George street and the view was pretty non existent. Also be aware this property does not have a pool. It does have a hot tub/spa, but it is a 6 person residential type, and not really pratical for a hotel of this size. I would give this hotel a 7/10 and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Average Sydney hotel”
Reviews.Author: BVC2
Reviews.Content: The hotel is sandwiched between Chinatown and the Entertainment Centre, which is quite convenient but means you won't get much of a view, at least not from the lower floors. The rooms are reasonably comfortable - not large, but I have seen much smaller in Sydney. Windows do not open, so it can get a little stuffy in the room. The gym is tiny, and the "whirlpool" (which seats just 4 people) would not operate when we tried it. Breakfast had quite a wide range including a self-serve juice bar, but was missing a few of my favourites e.g. toasted muesli, cream, and plain, gelatine-free yogurt. For tea and coffee, you have to catch the attention of the staff, but they do serve it hot. All the hotel staff were friendly and efficient. Overall it is a reasonable city hotel, but neither especially exciting nor a stand-out bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Close to all, but”
Reviews.Author: lloydb61
Reviews.Content: Close to everything, but dated, restaurant was small, food boring. Had a two singles room, room was small, beds were tiny. Bit pissed off that internet is $25 for a day! US hotels are free. The bar/food place was bigger , nicer food.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: r0bynS
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the holiday Inn darling Harbour for 3 nights. This is a lovely hotel and it is in a fantastic location. The rooms were clean and comfortable and the staff were friendly. I even used the hotel gym which was great!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ProfessorWilson
Reviews.Content: This was somewhat of an odd hotel. Staff was friendly and helpful. However, the hotel had quirks. When you turn off the lights at the front door, it kills the lights for the bathroom. Basically you had to turn the lights on in the entire room to go to the bathroom. No late night trips to the bathroom or you wake up everyone. In addition, there were only two lights, quite dark. The room overlooked the monorail, which was interesting, but quiet. The kids enjoyed waving at people when they rode by. The handicap bath was nice and functional, but two towels for four people no matter how nice you were. We also booked three rooms directly through Holiday Inn, which created a problem. There were apparently no double beds for accessible rooms as Holiday Inn stated. This was the reason for staying at the location. Wheel chair accessible means only five steps to your room. This was resolved only after I agreed to pay for a rollaway bed. After 35 hours of travel, you just accept defeat and live with the charge. The location is outstanding. Near Darling Harbor, Chinatown, 10 minute walk to quality shopping. The location and support staff makes the hotel tolerable.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, kind of strange location”
Reviews.Author: jhaberzetle
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn Darling Harbour for one night, the last night of our honeymoon in Australia. We got to the hotel at about 11:30PM after an evening flight from Cairns and checked out about 5AM to catch our flight home, so we were not at the hotel very long at all. The hotel seemed fine - our room was clean and comfortable. We had a room on the first floor, which had a strange layout - bathroom and closet just inside the door, then about 4 steps town to a sunken bedroom area just big enough for the queen size bed. But furnishings were decent and everything worked OK. The area around the hotel is really Chinatown more than Darling Harbour. There are mostly chinese restaurants in the area adjacent to the hotel, but we found a diner-style place that was still open at midnight to get some food before bed. The hotel suggested we take the airport shuttle instead of a taxi - the shuttle picks up from the hotel every half-hour starting at 5AM. This was a fairly quick way to the airport and it was cheaper than a taxi, only about $10 AUD per person.

Reviews.Title: “Poor "Front Desk" Service”
Reviews.Author: BEC77
Reviews.Content: Whilst this hotel is in a good location - within walking distance to Darling Harbour the Front Desk service that I experienced when checking in was extremely poor. A queen bed room was booked but could not be offered to me as they did not have any of these rooms left. When I asked could housekeeping please come up and make the twin beds into a double for us, she rudely said that this could not be done due to the hotel rules, but if I wanted to make it up myself I could - this meant moving side tables, beds and requesting new sheets / doonas etc. - Not a great way to have to start your stay! When we then enquired about car-parking the same lady on reception was once again very rude to us and could not even tell us where we should park - we had to go and locate the concierge ourselves to find this out. The hotel itself is of standard quality, but beginning to show the signs of a needed upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: DCCNewYorkCity
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located on the back of Chinatown in Sydney across from the convention center. Even though the monorail runs right outside the hotel, we barely heard any noise. The room was not that big but it was fine for us. The beds were all right too. The location is about a 30 minutes walk to Circular Quay but there are buses and trains near by. Even though it is near Darling Harbour, the walk to the ferry is not convenient. However, if you want to stay near shops, food, and street activity, then this would be a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Treasure, great for newcomers,”
Reviews.Author: Prebbletonite
Reviews.Content: The best location! Close to the market, china town, darling harbour and the wonderful chinese gardens. Not to mention the transport system. This hotel is unintrusive, the staff are helpful and polite but not in your face. I have stayed there 4 times and have recommended it to my family and the directors of the company I work for, they loved it too. It's a great hotel for people new to sydney because of it's location and there is no need for cabs to get around.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Nicky1001
Reviews.Content: Stayed for business late May 2008. Location is excellent - walk to Darling Harbour, right next to Chinatown, monorail stations and light rail very close. Clean, room size good, and so close to so much. Make sure you book a higher room though - monorail/traffic can be noisy on lower floors. Service was professional, even at reception and concierge when busy.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised despite high expectations :)”
Reviews.Author: Mykonosboy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent four nights at the Holiday Inn, Darling Harbor, on our first visit to Sydney in late June 2008. We decided on this hotel after reading the reviews on Tripadvisor and felt that all things considered, this hotel should meet our budget and needs quite nicely. And we were not disappointed. Checking in was swift, and the concierge, prompt and knowledgeable. There is also an ATM and a public phone (which allows you to make int'l calls inside the hotel lobby). More importantly, both were working. The hotel also kindly met our request to have a room on the higher floors (we were given one on level 10 - brilliant!). The room itself was clean, bright and cheery. Towels were aplenty and clean. The housekeeping staff we met during our stay there were polite and enthusiastic. So it may not be a bad idea to hang the "Do not Disturb" sign on the door, just to be sure you won't be disturbed by the housekeepers when sleeping in. F&B wise, the bar and restaurant looks great and cosy. The buffet breakfast we had at Shipley's on our final morning there (as usually, we would prefer to try all kinds of food out there) was quite good, despite the usual choices. There was also a refreshing blend-your-own-fresh fruit juice counter, and free flow of cappucino, expresso and lattes. The buffet queue was manageable due to the limited seats. So be warned that the morning breakfast crowd, coupled with the limited seats in this cozy Shipley's restaurant could mean a short wait before you are ushered to your table. Plan your time well to avoid unnecessary itinerary slippage. The three passenger lifts worked well and fast, minimising any time wasted on waiting for them. During our stay there, we also requested for a late check-out to accomodate our flight time and it was granted readily with a smile. Finally, to reach this hotel from the airport, you can take the Kingsford Smith Transporter airport shuttle service, which has a counter at the arrival hall. A return trip costs a reasonable AUD$22 per pax. The KST shuttle also picks up passengers from the hotel every 30 mins. We had no problems whatsoever with this arrangement with our own transfers. Location wise, Chinatown is right behind on the next street and Paddy's Market is just right outside the hotel. Lots of cheap and good Asian cuisine available from these places till late at night. Capitol Theatre (where we caught Billy Eillot) is also a 10 mins stroll away. Lastly, there is also a Macdonald's just across the road at the Sydney Entertainment Centre in case this is important to you. There are a smattering of convenient stores around the hotel but the nearest 7-11 is two streets away. For more upmarket dining choices, the happening Darling Harbor is a mere 5 -10 mins walk away, taking you on a lovely stroll across a park. To reach the City Centre quickly, you can take a bus (AUD$1.80) from George Street - which is mere minutes from the hotel. At the bus stop in front of the hotel, you can board the Sydney Explorer Bus. If you desire something more direct, I notice that a taxi or two is always parked perpetually in front of the hotel. If you wish to stay in Darling Harbor but do not mind not having a harbor view, this is an excellent value for money choice to consider.

Reviews.Title: “Watch what you sign up for”
Reviews.Author: jbar434
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice enough, but I was there with my significant other and they gave us two twin beds. When we called down to get it resolved the first girl we talked to was NOT helpful and pretty much an airhead. The gentleman who helped us with our bags was MUCH better! He noticed the situation, went down and spoke to the manager on our behalf and they moved us immediately to another room. Although the room had a view of a cement wall at least it had a double bed. The location is within a 5 min walk of Darling Harbour.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: Orks
Reviews.Content: We arrived May 25, group of 10 but only 3 rooms ready, other 2 were not. We were assigned to level 1 rooms, which for some structural/architectural design were sunken from the corridor. Bathrooms were level with the corridor. a little bit small for my comfort but sufficient otherwise. Rooms were clean, beds were neat, bath was standard ok. There were no complimentary slippers. Aircon controls were simple & accurate. There were NO electrical outlet for foreign electrical gadgets. We ask for an adopter from the front desk, but unfortunately, it was very very loose and wont work unless you hold it with both hands. Since the hotel had no more extra/spare I had to buy from a store which was pretty stiff at Aus$7. The breakfast buffet was nice & sufficient. what i find rather nice & extra-ordinary was that they provided a juicer so you can make your own fresh apple, pineapple, cellery, carrots, melon juice. The hotel was located near Chinatown so lunch/dinner was a matter of choices & more choices. It is also very near bargain shopping & the Darling harbour area.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel but the breakfast buffet guy is a total racist”
Reviews.Author: Dentelle
Reviews.Content: Well, this hotel is wonderful except for the racist breakfast buffet receptionist. The rooms were spacious enough and had well equipped beds and cabinets. The bed was wonderful and was a real comfort for our backs especially after an intense day of touring Sydney. The TV had enough channels and we didn't get bored with it. The furniture was also adequate and things went well. All in all, this hotel was wonderful- the housekeeping was superb and the room was really cozy for us. oh yeah, i forgot to say so but the hotel's location was really fantabulous! It was near Paddy's ( the flea market open only from Thursday to Sunday) and the attractions of Chinatown. if you stay in this hotel, food wont be a problem because of all the restaurants and kiosks just a few blocks away. BUT, here comes the pinch, as i've said several times already, the breakfast buffet receptionist was a TOTAL RACIST. He's a middle-aged Chinese guy and this is how he does his discrimination. When the guests are Caucacians (especially the blonde guests and the guys) , he's really nice and hospitable and he's like an angel. He gives the Western guests pleasant greetings and really speaks to them in a polite manner and he really hides all the rudeness in him. he's like this:" Good morning sir/ ma'am! =)How are you today? having breakfast on your own or with your friends? Anyways, let me show you to your seat. =D " But, when it comes to us, the Asian guests, he gets all bossy and mean plus he gets so impolite. He's like this: "Hey you! X( What's your ROOM NUMBER?! COME WITH ME!!!!!!! Here!" We felt that he's a very impolite receptionist because it's his job to show every guest to their seats PROPERLY and he should'nt just choose to whom he should he be polite to. And, the fact that the people he chose to despise were of the same race as him, we felt that he was very unreasonable. The most discriminating part of that receptionist's attitude was that when we were at the juicer station at the buffet, there were Caucacians sitting at the table near the station. There were three of us from our party who were helping out in making the juice so it was quite crowded that the only space i could stand on was beside the teble of the Caucacians and when the receptionist passed by, he just suddenly pushed me from where i was standingso when he could've just said 'excuse me' or asked me to move! If you're a Caucacian, you'd have fun at breakfast because he'll be all over you and he'll be really hospitable. But, if you're Asian, it'll really be annoying to deal with this receptionist. This is a good hotel, but I suggest that everyone have breakfast somewhere else instead (even if the food at the buffet is good) so that they won't experience racism at breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, great rooms”
Reviews.Author: canatrace
Reviews.Content: Booked most of our hotels for Australia and New Zealand trip based on other trip advisor postings. Spent 4 nights in this Hotel. We made sure to ask that our room was higher up or on the other side of the hotel to avoid the noise of the monorail which runs right in front of the hotel's (about) 4th floor. Stayed on the 8th floor and had no noise problems. Room was updated, rather large, and very clean. Had a fridge in it as well. Location of this hotel is close to the train, touristy bus servive, light rail and monorail. Very easy to get around. Internet was $5 for 30 minutes, never had to wait to get in and log on. It was quick and fast, unlike some other places we stayed which took forever to upload pictures. Staff was nice enough. Concierge was kind enough to look up a few things on internet about Sydney, and make tour recommendations and food recomendations. Take note - this hotel appears to be right on the edge of Chinatown. We knew it was close, but was closer than expected. For a few nights we wandered up and down the bustling Chinatown streets and had amazing food. We just weren't prepared for that to be the main option in very close proximity. Would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Sydney Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Islandgirl060
Reviews.Content: I had read the fairly mixed reports on this hotel so was not quite sure what to expect. I needn't have worried. Without a doubt this is the best Hotel experience I have ever had in my 60+ years. Firstly, the building and renovation works are complete, so absolutely no noise from that. The staff were all magnificent, efficient, friendly and very helpful. The breakfast which I had included in my room rate was all that could be desired and more. The check-in went smoothly, and even though I arrived at 8am in the morning, I was thrilled that my room was ready. We were on the 11th floor in the new extension and the room was amazing. All and more that could be expected, double aspect full length windows, a proper wardrobe, a 'fridge and 'kitchen sink' bathrobes and slippers, fresh fruit daily and complimentary bottled water, bath and seperate shower and very good lighting and finnished with a 32 inch plasma TV!. In-room internet access was included in our tariff, but is on a 'pay by use' tariff in other rooms. The location was also one of the best we could have hoped for, being right next to China town with amazing shops and eateries ranging from budget to more expensive meals. There were several convenience stores nearby. The awe inspiring Darling Harbour was on the door step from where you get ferries to lots of other Sydney areas. Bus, light rail (tram) monorail and rail connections were also all within walking distance. Paddy's Market was right next door - open on Thursday, Friday, Saturday and Sundays where you could do your souvenir shopping all in one go. Above Paddys Market is Market City for discount stores etc.. All in all we would not hesitate to return and we intend too! I would personally recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: bellebellec
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for 2 nights 16th apr 08. great location short walk from darling harbour and next to monorail. we had a standard room on high floor and it was large clean and tidy. the hotel staff were very helpful and overall would recommend this hotel for anyone looking to stay on darling harbour for reasnable price. the breakfast was very expensive though and i would recommend venturing out instead! outside of the hotel we had some fantastic meals in particular Ice Cube in darling harbour. Fish orientated menu, great service and great value for money. Also the meat and wine restaurant was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Austin-Powers63
Reviews.Content: We needed a one night in stay in Sydney to attend a concert at the Entertainment Centre. Holiday Inn Darling Harbour could not have been any closer to the venue and is very handily located for other activities in and around Darling Harbour and Chinatown. I believe the hotel has undergone a recent renovation and had additional floor(s) added. Starting with reception everything was excellent. Desk staff were extremely courteous and efficient. The Concierge had an excellent knowledge of the city and was able to give great assistance with driving directions etc. Parking is limited and we were accomodated in the Entertainment Centre Car Park which was a short 3 minute walk. The room we had booked several months back direct through the hotel was a queen deluxe with breakfast package and we were pleasantly surprised to receive an upgrade to an executive suite on one of the new upper floors. The room was great in every regard. Spacious, spotless,modern and well furnished. As we were on a high floor, monorail noise mentioned in other reviews was not an issue. Eating options at the hotel included a restaurant that served an excellent breakfast buffet and a bar/grill with a limited but good quality and well priced menu and drinks. They cater well for people attending evening concerts at the Entertainment Centre across the road. Meals are light with a reasonable choice on the special "show menu". It was hard to find fault with this hotel and based on this experience we would most definitely stay again. Accor hotels often receive mediocre reviews for the perception of "generic brand" or "sameness" but to some of us there is a certain comfort in knowing what to expect quality wise. This is the case with most Holiday Inns we have stayed at. The same concept of familiarity seems to work ok for McDonalds !!. 10/10 Holiday Inn Darling Harbour.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location- Pity About The Monorail”
Reviews.Author: Tafftraveller
Reviews.Content: Spent four nights at the hotel at the start of our Australian holiday. We found the hotel to be in an ideal location easy access to local transport , bus , monorail , chinatown and 5 -10 minute walk to Darling Harbour. Paddys Market is at the end of the road. The hotel room we had was very nice, large and well furnished, the facilities at the hotel are good. This is a large hotel, unfortunately our room on the first floor at the front of the building had the monorail right outside the window. Advise you ask for a room on a higher level or away from the front of the building. Sydney has so much to offer its hard to know were to start. We climbed the bridge, went on the ferry to Manly, visited the botanical gardens etc ,etc.

Reviews.Title: “Recent Upgrade”
Reviews.Author: steve_fossil
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel regularly for business and pleasure. It is in a great location, right next to Chinatown, across the road from the Sydney Entertainment Centre and a short walk from Darling Harbour. They have recently renovated their bar/bistro and have also started to upgrade rooms. While it is not in the most glamorous part of the city it is well worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “very noisy”
Reviews.Author: dagobert
Reviews.Content: i stayed only one night in this hotel in april 2008 at the end of our australian trip. The hotel is located nearby china town. I must say, that it was very noisy. We had a room at the back of the hotel and we heard the airconditioning machines from the buildings across the street. When you have a room to the street, you have the monorail directly in front of your window. So it is hard to find a quiet room. Overall the best years of this hotel are over. I also stood in the novotel darling harbour, it was cheaper and better. I would not choose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: elonie
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nicer than expected. We were given a good size room for the two of us and a baby. They provided the portable cot for free and when we put the cot by the window, there was still enough space for the baby to play on the floor. The TV remote has some problems and ABC channel appears black & white at times. We read previous reviews that the hotel has undergone some renovations recently and we noticed the foyer was done up quite nicely. It was great to be so close to Chinatown for some cheap meals. It was also very close to the Powerhouse Museum.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sally-7
Reviews.Content: A high standard hotel in an excellent location. A short walk from Darling Harbour with plenty of attractions and places to eat and drink. We had a large room which catered very well for 3 adults. The breakfast was delicious, as was the meal we had at the hotel. Would definitely return here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Good Value”
Reviews.Author: birtleman
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is near Darling Harbour and not on the waterfront. The location is excellent and in our opinion better than the Sydney Harbour Holiday Inn. It is less than 5 min walk to Darling Harbour and the excelent eating/drinking establishments there. It is also very near Chinatown, the light rail and the monorail. The staff were helpful and the value for money excellent. The rooms are small but adequate and very clean. We would stay there again and would recmomend this hotel and area for 1st time visitors to Sydney. It was an excelent choice as we were there for 4 days before a cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Good for conference”
Reviews.Author: robmigrates
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a few days when at a conference in early November 2007. Contrary to some of the other posts here I found the staff very helpful. The rooms are adequate (if a little on the small side) but the location is great. Chinatown is to the rear and a short walk to convention centre.

Reviews.Title: “Lived to tell.”
Reviews.Author: FattyMcFatterson
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with 40 other students for a study abroad program. I was there at the hotel for almost two weeks! The beds were comfortable. The rooms were clean. The dining at the hotel was okay. The staff was extremely helpful. (Jeffie was my favorite!!) The location was great at first then after a week or two you want to be in a different area besides chinatown. The hotel was just across the street from darling harbor, which was convienient. Overall I wouldn't probably stay there again, but it was prearranged with my study abroad program. But then again, I never ever stay at a Holiday Inn, but for a Holiday Inn it wasn't bad at all. It was almost like staying at their sister hotel the Crown Plaza, but just not as nice.

Reviews.Title: “Wrong Hotel”
Reviews.Author: davidindublin
Reviews.Content: If you want to vist Sydney and see the sights with only a few days to spare this is NOT the hotel for you. My mistake was confusing Darling Harbour for Sydney Harbour (thats the one with the Opera house, bridge etc). This hotel is only really suitable for you if you want to be inbetween Chinatown and the very tacky Darling Harbour and we would have moved hotels immediately if we hadnt already paid for it. The rooms are small, stuffy (the windows dont open) and very depressing.I enclose a photograph of the view !. It really was like a small dark box and other guests we talked to were equally depressed. The hotel you want is the Old Sydney Holiday Inn which is a far better hotel and in a fabulous location...lots to do and see..great bars and places to eat. We compared the prices of the two Holiday Inns while we were there and thet were the same at that time. Dont make the same mistake I did...DARLING HARBOUR IS CERTAINLY NOT SYDNEY HARBOUR.

Reviews.Title: “Surprise construction ruined anniversary stay”
Reviews.Author: BayTrav
Reviews.Content: This hotel is under heavy construction. They are adding floors, so there is heavy equipment on the roof, which creates tremendous vibration and noise. I made two advance calls to the hotel to ask about room size and location, as this was an anniversary trip. Nothing was said about the construction. The night before arrival, I called them again to verify that we would have an upper floor/view location and, again, not a word was said about the construction--particularly amazing given my request for an upper floor. The room was attractive, but who cared? When I complained to the manager on duty, he said that the hotel had put this info on their website for months (not true), and that all desk/reservation personnel had been trained to tell guests --also absolutely not true. He refused any request for a discount or anything at all - too bad, live with it, we told you, it's your fault. Also, construction was supposed to begin at 9 a.m., but on the Saturday we left, it was well underway by 7 a.m. Avoid this place like the plague it is.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: dr_read
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn for 6 nights at the beginning of November. The location is very good â€“ a 5 min walk to Darling Harbor and probably a 20 min walk to Sydney Harbor. We found the hotel to be clean and in good decorative order with contemporary furnishings. Our â€˜Queen Bed Superior Roomâ€™ was quite roomy with plenty of space to put luggage down. The bed was comfortable and we found the hotel to be very quiet which made it easy to get to sleep at night. We ate breakfast in the hotel restaurant only on one morning and we found the buffet to be splendid with a good choice of hot and cold food. Overall staff at the hotel were friendly, although I did find them somewhat uncooperative when they tried to throw us out after they bungled our reservation â€“ still waiting for an apology for that! I would stay at this hotel again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel. Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: goldcoastguy71
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel mainly because it was one of the few 4+ star hotels not to jack their prices up considerably due to a soccer match being held the same night (which was the purpose of my trip anyway). The mention of "Darling Harbour" in the title is a bit of a misnomer, as it is one street off Chinatown, yet a good 10-15 min walk to the heart of Darling Harbour. The hotel is directly across the road from the Sydney Entertainment Centre. Very convenient for those attending concerts or basketball matches at that venue. Express checkout was very convenient. Porters and Front desk staff were quite friendly and efficient. The one downside is the power switch at the door (like many hotels these days) requires your room key to be inserted (or an unneeded card of any type will do). Housekeeping will remove the card if you are absent. In my case, my mobile phone and laptop failed to charge fully. Had absolutely no issue with the renovations at the property. There are many notices in the hotel advising of the renovations and the times you will experience noise (which from memory was from 0830-1800). While I did hear a bit of noise during those times, it wasn't enough to annoy me (maybe I picked a good day).

Reviews.Title: “Good Sydney Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SF-Coast-Traveler
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Holiday Inn Darling Harbor for three nights. This was my third stay at this property within the last six years. The hotel is in a great location just behind Chinatown, a ten minute walk from the Central Railway Station, a 15 minute walk from the CBD, and a one minute walk from the light rail and monorail stations (at Paddy's Market). The Sydney Entertainment Center is directly across the street, Paddy's Market one block away, and Darling Harbor a pleasant 10 minute walk from the hotel. Check-in was handled quickly and efficiently by the friendly and helpful staff. The common areas as well as the room were clean and well maintained. The only issue requiring attention was the tile and molding around the tub that had splotches of mildew that needed to be removed. Otherwise, the room was spotless. The towels and linens were clean and crisp and the bed quite comfortable. The hotel has a guest laundry room on the third floor. A$3 to wash and A$3 to dry. The hotel has placed two comfortable lounge chairs and reading material in the room so you can be comfortable if you decide to wait for your wash to finish. My room (and I'm assuming all rooms) had an iron and ironing board in the room. The airport shuttle bus / van stops at this hotel A$12 (up to 50+ minutes from the airport because the bus stops at multiple hotels and usually doesn't leave the airport until it has multiple passengers) or you can take the Airport Train to Central Station (10 minute train ride) if you are traveling light; A$13.50 one way. It's a short 10 minute walk from the train station down Hay Street (turn left), then to Paddy's Market (turn right - hotel is one block down). OR, you can take the light rail from Central Station to Paddy's Market; about 4 minutes and A$3. At a rate of US$110 per night, it was an excellent option for my stay in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “It'll be great when it's finished.”
Reviews.Author: ChelseaTraveller
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is fantastic, 5 minutes from Darling Harbour and right next to China Town and Paddy's market. The room was great (I had a upgrade) and for me pretty quiet. The biggest problem with this hotel is the reception, it's probably the worst run front desk I've ever seen. Nothing happens unless there's a manager present, they are completely disorganised, long queues were utterly ignored and the noise levels - echoes and background noise rather than building work related, made it a real battle to be heard. That said the concierge desk was excellent, really effecient, friendly and helpful; in stark contrast to the reception across the hall. The building work, they're adding extra floor wasn't too intrusive for me and I guess the hassle factor it did create was reflected in the good rate I got.

Reviews.Title: “Dreadfull Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BBoomers
Reviews.Content: My parents stayed at this hotel last year and found it to be excellent and this is why I chose this hotel. BUT while the bed was Comfortable and the room tidy it was very noisy due to overlooking the back laneway. I was allocated a non smoking room but torists were smoking on the floor so smelled strongly of cigarette smoke. Room was booked direct with Hotel (not their website) and credit card number taken so room could be charged to the card. I was advised this was all fine. HOWEVER on arriving at hotel was told this was not noted on their records and I would have to pay cash for the room plus a A$100 deposit before they would hand over the room keys. Staff on front desk extremely rude and uncoperative. I intend to tell all my friends about this hotel and myself or none of my family will every stay at a here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Nice room”
Reviews.Author: Johnrgn
Reviews.Content: The hotel is currently under going work on the restuarant and they are adding further rooms to the top floor of the oldest part of the building. However, we asked for a room away from the work and I have to be honest, we did not hear a thing. The room was clean, well decorated but on the small side. Having said that, there is so much to do in Sydney we only returned to the room to sleep. The monorail also passes extremely close to the hotel (again as our room was at the back of the hotel, this did not disturb us). The hotel was a 15 minute walk to Darling Harbour which has lots of bars and restuarants and also the ferry service to Sydney Harbour. The hotel itself is two minutes from China Town. All in all, a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “An awful stay”
Reviews.Author: Worldtravellerboy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights. This would be the worst place I have stayed, staff were totally imcopetent and rude and when we finally got food it was not fit for human consumption. Everything was blamed on alterations taking place, even the fact that drinks could not be supplied. Rooms were not clean and smelt musty. Looked like there had been a flood in our room. Backpackers lodge would be better and you would be treated better. Staff up to management level were not interested in complaints either.

Reviews.Title: “Good value short stay”
Reviews.Author: chalkntalk
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights in January with our teenage children. I think they did a fantastic job considering Sydney and this hotel was packed with England cricket fans. Staff were friendly and helpful. The cheaper restaurant downstairs was great for children, if a little lively. The room was perfect for what we wanted; two queen beds and coffee-making area. It was clean, modern and in a great location. What more could you want?

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but a strange room”
Reviews.Author: Ozstitcher
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 1 night on 22 September. I booked the room through HI's website and got a 14 day advance pre-paid rate. I booked a 2 queen bed room and that's what we got. We had a few problems driving to the hotel - first of all, there were roadworks at the end of the street and we couldn't get through. Luckily we're locals, so had our trusty street directory & managed to find another way around. Then when we arrived at the hotel, the car park was full so we had to park at the Ent Centre and had our ticket validated by the hotel. $15 per 24 hrs. There are renovations going on in the public areas which are supposed to be finished on 1 October. I found the lobby to be a bit small especially when crowded with people coming and going. I'm not sure if this will change once the renovations are done. Our room was nice...the beds were very comfy and sheets clean. The fridge is inside a cupboard with lots of room to make coffee etc. The only downside I could find was the lighting. Our room (134) had a very small window and it faced into an alleyway so was quite dark. Even with the lights on, it was dim. The lights didn't seem to have very bright globes in them. Plus you needed to have your room keycard in a slot to work the power. There are 4 steps from the room door down to the sleeping area. I wonder if many people fall down the stairs as they are located directly in front of the door & as it's dark when you enter, it's hard to see the stairs. The bathroom & wardrobe were both located just near the door so if you needed to get up in the middle of the night, you had to negotiate the stairs. The bathroom was modern with sufficient towels and what looked like a new shower screen (the shower curtain rod was still attached to the ceiling). The shower was in the bath but there was a railing for assistance. The shower head was quite high (a problem I see other people complain about but not me, cos I'm short!) and the water pressure was good. The hot water came through quite quickly. The breakfast buffet was $24.50 per person and children are free. This is around the normal price for buffet brekkie in Sydney and as we were only staying one night, we decided to have it. There was quite a long line waiting for tables as obviously we were there at the busiest time of the morning. The selections were pretty standard. Overall, I would recommend this hotel. The location is good for Darling Harbour and Chinatown.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: SF-Traveler01
Reviews.Content: We booked for one night as we were flying out of Sydney the next morning. Whenen we arrived at the hotel, we were told that we were upgraded to a suite from the standard room we had booked for one night. The hotel is currently undergoing remodeling, and we found that it was either directly above to next door to the upgraded room we were put in. Starting around 8am, the drills started and it was incredibly disturbing. I suppose for the majority of tourists who are out an about during the day, it's not a problem, but we were sleeping in to catch a mid afternoon flight and were unable to sleep through the noise. Additionally, our room appeared to be through some remodeling with new carpet (but missing molding on the walls), and a new bathroom with separate shower from tub, and a very large living/work space with internet access (around $0.55 per minute). There was a mid afternoon heavy rainstorm and we found one of the windows failed to have proper seals and water came into the room. It wasn't enough to flood, however, it probably damaged their walls. The location of the hotel is okay, right in Darling Harbour and in Chinatown, and close to the train station. One of the hotel restaurant/pub is currently undergoing renovation, and so there was one restaurant open and the menu looked okay though it was a bit pricey (but we found all hotel restaurant food to be pricey on our trip). We didn't have a problem with the service of staff, and check in/out was fairly easy.

Reviews.Title: “A handy stop over choice”
Reviews.Author: Warby40
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for one night. Had booked a Superior Twin, however on arrival were upgraded to Queen Suite. As wanted twin room, and not keen on position of room on 3rd floor (monorail directly outside window) requested move back to Superior Twin on higher floor - got 7th floor. Staff were very good at addressing issues and sent up a porter to move cases between rooms. Hotel appears to be going through some refurbishment. Bedroom looked recently updated however the bathroom was tiny and in need of an update (and certainly a new shower curtain minus holes)!! Tea/coffee facilities, hairdryer etc all provided. Room service available - we opted for the takeaway section of the menu. Hotel is in walking distance of Darling Harbour, shops, restaurants, Aquarium, Maritime Museum, Chinatown and Paddy's Market. Taxis available outside and Monorail station around corner.

Reviews.Title: “great location, bad service”
Reviews.Author: yapnelann
Reviews.Content: stayed at the darling harbour holiday inn. The location was great, right there at China town, restaurants everywhere, the monorail station is also nearby. Paddy's market is like 2 mins walk. Rooms were however very small. We were given the 1st floor rooms, and we were right under the monorail track, however noise was not a problem. Service is terrible. Staffs at the front desk were impatient, I made an enquiry about internet access from the room and the person on the phone was rude and unhelpful. Very shocking and unpleasant encounter.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place, staff were amazing!”
Reviews.Author: carlita1uk
Reviews.Content: Clean, welcoming, ALL the facilities you would expect and more. Great location, we loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent buy for the money!”
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights at the Holiday Inn Darling Harbor, June 2007. Only (minor) complaint is room set up. As we arrived extremely early in the morning, room assigned on the 2nd floor was fully acceptable. After 2 nights, being seniors, requested if we could change to a room without the compulsory 4-steps from the room to the bathroom/closet/entry area. Not a problem. Concierge assistance excellent! Speak with Takeshi Hirama, he is most knowledgeable and willing to assist. Can't wait to return, stay there again. Definitely enjoy breakfast at McDonald's, across the street, in lieu of the restaurant buffet. Buffett is quite pricey!

Reviews.Title: “greta location”
Reviews.Author: bendusastre
Reviews.Content: Great location close to public transport and chinatown. Hotel is called darling harbour but is a good 15min walk to the harbour. Modern rooms with clean bathroom. Staff was average. Did not eat at restaurants Parking was expensive at $25/day. Paid $100/night on priceline and got exactly what i paid for. no dispaointments there.

Reviews.Title: “good choice for Sydney”
Reviews.Author: voito
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideally situated close to the Darling Harbour recreation/entertainment area of Sydney. Actually, it's more between Chinatown and Darling Harbour, but the beautiful harborside itself with a multitude of museums, activities, gardens, restaurants and shops is within easy walking distance. You won't get any surprises with this hotel if you've stayed at Holiday Inns before. Service is efficient, rooms are well-maintained and the hotel has everything you need for a decent stay. The building is not particularly new or unique, but compared to other hotels in Sydney it's a good deal; the Old Sydney Holiday Inn is substantially more expensive, for example. Chinatown's Dixon Street is an interesting stroll just behind the hotel, and the nearby huge Market City complex is a fun place to shop for souvenirs, branded goods and food. Overall this is a solid choice when factoring price vs. accomodations, recreational opportunities and transportation access.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place, excellent price”
Reviews.Author: sfeldhaus79
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn Darling Harbour is a great location! We had a fabulous time in a wonderful city! Regarding the hotel, it is very nice-- It has all "the basics" you will need. It's not too fancy or extravagant, but the hotel is clean and the staff is very friendly and helpful! If you are looking for a nice hotel, this is the one. I would strongly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth a look”
Reviews.Author: NomadQatar
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights during a business trip. Probably far better than many people might imagine for a middle of the road hotel. Excellent staff on check in and in the dining room. Clean, well presented rooms with comfortable bed and the usual facilities. Good location - Darling Harbour, many local restaurants and other activities.

Reviews.Title: “Great central location”
Reviews.Author: DiseyW
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very central to everything in Sydney such as Chinatown, the shopping district and the beautiful Darling Harbour. The staff were always friendly and helpful. The only slight downside for us was that we were staying on a room only basis and ravenously hungry on the first morning of our stay after arriving from England we found that the breakfast was very expensive compared to a lot of other places so we decided to leave the hotel and have a McDonalds breakfast which is just over the road next to the Entertainment centre. Nice clean rooms that were large enough for us and our two children and not at all noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay; Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Manigat
Reviews.Content: Great stay in a great location. We checked in on 7 April and checked out on 15 April. We purchased the 7-day City Rail travel pass which cost $139USD for five of us and gave us unlimited travel on all their trains, ferries and busses. Even with a 5 year old, we were only a 5 minute walk to the nearest bus stop on George Street, a 10 minute walk from Central Station, 15 minutes from Town Hall Station, and a 10-15 minute walk to the Sydney Aquarium, Sydney Wildlife World and the Darling Harbour ferry. You are close to all of Sydneyâ€™s top attractions. The front desk and concierge members were great. The gym and laundry room are basically co-located separated by a door on the third floor. The gym has one LifeCycle treadmill and Cross Trainer elliptical machine and a circuit weight set. The laundry room has two washers and dryers which can lead to long waits. Overall, it was a great experienceâ€¦Iâ€™d definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent discounted rooms”
Reviews.Author: Thomidog
Reviews.Content: I've just stayed two nights in Darling Harbour with my 5yo son at the Holiday Inn on Harbour St, opposite the Entertainment Centre (which was therefore the view) and next to a monorail stop, the tram line and Paddy's Markets. It was amazingly quiet as the road directly outside seems to be a restricted access one with hardly any traffic. I booked the twin room through one of the websites that pop up when you google 'discount holidays sydney' or some such, and got it for $139 per night. This was a good price given the quality and standard of accommodation - lovely big, air conditioned room, comfortable beds, still new carpet, clean walls, Foxtel, gameboy facilities, internet; lovely bathroom with shower over bath and plenty of space. Complimentary everything ie shampoo and conditioner, shower cap etc, tea, coffee, milk - the only possible catch being the non-complimentary wine, orange juice, chocolates, muesli bars, crisps, soft drink etc which are also provided at exorbitant cost should you lack the discipline to resist them! Food at the in-house restaurants was also expensive to my mind although comparable with other classy restaurants in the area. We ate our own food for brekky and packed lunch, and ate elsewhere the 1st night. On the 2nd night I found I was able to get a decent room service meal for both of us by ordering from the kids menu - we had battered fish with steamed vegies, fruit salad & ice cream, about $18 and the single serves were easily big enough for both of us. Service at this hotel was impeccable and security is excellent as everything operates on cards. We were able to go from our hotel room to the Aquarium and other attractions without folding up our stroller! So if you're traveling with a young child or if you are yourself reliant on wheels through a disability, this is an excellent place to stay. If you're travelling on the cheap, treat yourself by searching 6 or 7 days ahead and booking the less popular, discounted nights. Our room went up to $199 if we'd wanted to stay a 3rd night.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Hedge3
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights in the Holiday Inn Darling Harbour and considered it a good hotel. Fair for the price. Helpful staff, clean rooms, good bar. Walking distance to Darling Harbour - through a nice park too. From here you can get a ferry to Circular Quay which is a nicer way to get around Sydney. The monorail stops right by the hotel so it is easy to get to from the centre (by the Tower and around that area). We'd stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, smart, pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: ThePieBoy
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at The Darling Harbour Holiday Inn for 6 nights in January 2007. The location is excellent for most of Sydney, if not a little far from the Bridge and Opera House, but great public transport makes up for this fact. It is based on the edge of the very pleasant Chinatown; a five-minute walk to Darling Harbour. For first-timers such as ourselves, its non-central location may help you to enjoy the less-obvious aspects of Sydney. Darling Harbour / Cockle Bay Wharf is a treat, with restaurants to cater for all tastes (including vegetarians - mainly Italian), bars, cafes, ice cream parlours and the Imax. The hotel itself is very clean and the interior design was very impressive for the price you pay. The air conditioning unit was effective and quiet. The staff were very friendly, and helpful with our enquiries. You have to use your room key if you wish to use the lift / elevator, which is reassuring in terms of security. We were on the 6th floor, and happily, despite night-time roadworks outside for two nights, we found the room to be very quiet and did not suffer from the monorail noise either. The hotel bar is expensive, but the staff are excellent and has a pleasant atmosphere when busy (and it will be busy when an event has finished at the Entertainment Centre across the road!) Overall, a suprisingly nice hotel and one that I would be more than happy to use again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: Paul C
Reviews.Content: We liked this hotel, there is complementary fresh fruit and water in your room each day, there rooms were very clean and modern, a magnifying mirror for makeup and shaving, lots of soap and shampoo, they supplied terrycloth robes and slippers being from the states it was our first encounter with the tea pot for boiling water but it worked great and the instant coffee was fine for a morning start. The Consignor staff was very helpful. The location, across the street is the market and stop for the monorail and the red Sydney explorer bus. One street behind the hotel is China Town; on Friday night they close the street and have an open market, three blocks walk to Darling Harbor, and a few blocks to George Street for the busses and train stop. The only point of contention was there in room internet service was expensive this is true thru out Australia.

Reviews.Title: “Dismal and smelly”
Reviews.Author: zodiac
Reviews.Content: This hotel is dismal ,smelly and noisy. The desk staff are hopeless.Don't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “a very good hotel to explore sydney from”
Reviews.Author: trevor-wa
Reviews.Content: my wife and I and two relatives stayed two nites at the end of a cruise, our first time to Sydney - The Holiday Inn is well maintained and well managed and in a very good central location to explore all of Sydney ( Sydney is large enough and has seperate areas to explore that no hotel will be perfect for everywhere, but this is a good compromise ). Price was a fair value for the area, our only comment was the $25 asd per day for in room internet access is a bit steep.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent base to explore Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Scottiboy
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well situated in close proximity to both China Town and Darling Harbour with all of its restaurants, shopping & bars. There are also transport links nearby with the monorail, tram and train stations all located close to the hotel which can take you into town, circular quay or further afield. The hotel itself is clean & functional but by no means luxurious. We had a high floor so were not bothered by the noise and i would recommend anybody booking the hotel requests to be higher up as there is a busy street & monorail line close to the lower rooms. The room was fine for a base to explore from with a comfy bed and reasonable bathroom, if you are looking for luxury then go elsewhere. We really enjoyed our week long stay at the hotel and would definately recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Nogwater
Reviews.Content: Overall Darling Harbor exceeded our expectations. The rooms were modern, clean, and very comfortable. We stayed here for three nights and the concierge was one the most helpful that we've encountered in our travels. The other facilities, such as laundry, gym, restaurants, etc., were also very nice. The hotel is well situated in relation to Darling Harbour, on the edge of China Town, overlooks the Sydney Entertainment Centre, and is wrapped by the monorail. Even with all of these venues in close proximity, the hotel is extremely quite and an excellent place to return to for an afternoon nap or an evening rest. The only drawback is that the hotel is a bit of a walk from the primary Sydney tourist sites -- Opera House, the Rocks, the Bridge Climb, etc. However, if you don't mind walking or taking public transit, it is a great and affordable base from which to experience Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Respectable”
Reviews.Author: TorontoTim
Reviews.Content: A decent hotel in a convenient location, at the west end of Darling Harbour. We had a small suite on the 9th floor (an upgrade from the queen room we had reserved). The hallway carpets were disgustingly dirty, but the suite itself was fine, although unremarkable. As other reviewers have noted, the monorail runs right in front of the hotel, at the level of the second floor. We could barely hear it from our floor, so it wasnâ€™t an issue for us, but I can imagine that it would be more of a nuisance lower down. The minibar fridge was turned off, so it and the drinks in it were warm, and the ice cube tray contained warm water. The only alternative for ice was to call room service, which wasnâ€™t an appealing option.

Reviews.Title: “value option”
Reviews.Author: Alena&Steve
Reviews.Content: Centrally located about 10min walk to Darling Harbour/Central railway station and next to monorail station. Rooms were quite basic- this is not a 5 star hotel- but it was comfortable enough. As far as city accommodation goes it is reasonable value for money but if your looking for stylish accommodation look elsewhere. A cramped gym but had all the equipment needed in good condition - there was no pool but a small spa next to the gym ( entry through laundry)Didnt try the restaurant but bar next door served as a good starting ending point for the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Tedmo
Reviews.Content: Good sized, clean room. Opposite the monorail and entertainment centre (we were suprised to discover that Kylie was performing there during our stay). Short walk to Darling Harbour and next to China Town.We had a nice meal in the lounge bar but have to say that the decor was a little dated. In all,this was an ideal hotel for our needs - comfortable and central for touring.

Reviews.Title: “Good, hotel, ok location.”
Reviews.Author: chardacr
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the holiday inn darling harbour for 5 nights in Nov 06, the hotel is very clean, and rooms very spacious. Great location for china town, darling harbour, central station, buses, monorail, light railway, markets. but a bit of a treck to the rocks/botanic gardens, circular key etc.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Bang For the Buck”
Reviews.Author: GlobalEyes
Reviews.Content: I found the Holiday Inn Darling Harbour to be a bargain compared to other hotels in Sydney. The room was spacious, clean and comfortable. Factor in the friendly staff and good location with a very reasonable price and you have a smart selection for the budget traveller (but not too budget!). Lots of tourist sites, a plethora of restaurants and shopping areas within walking distance from this hotel. This is a solid choice for those who donâ€™t need a four-star accommodation, but still want a well-kept, comfortable and centrally-located hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: lal32
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at the Holiday Inn Darling Harbour in November and enjoyed our stay. Both the check in and check out process was quick and easily handled by staff that were friendly, helpful and professional. Our room was a good size for the rate we paid, was exceptionally clean and had everything you could need. We had a few drinks in the hotel bar which also very nice. We could hear the monorail a little bit at night, but it certainly wasnâ€™t enough to disturb neither my wife nor I from getting a good nightâ€™s sleep. The location is very good. Directly opposite the Sydney Entertainment Centre if you need to attend anything there. Central Rail Station is about a 10 minute walk away. The centre of Darling Harbour is only a 5 minute walk. We also had no problem hailing a taxi in front of the hotel at any time day or night. We loved Sydney very much and plan to visit again as soon as possible. When we do, I wonâ€™t bother looking for a different hotel. Weâ€™ll certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and Price for Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Vardomannen
Reviews.Content: Sydney is not the cheapest place in the world to stay, especially if you want a property that a reasonably central and clean and comfortable. This hotel is 5 minutes walk from Darling Harbour - cross the road and go around the back of the bar on the other side and from there on it is pedestrians only. The hotel itself is midern, well-equipped and well-run. Clean and comfortable, offering all you need for a stay in the big city. Prices are low if you book in advance and represent good value. I would not hesitate to return.

Reviews.Title: “4 OUT OF 5”
Reviews.Author: PAJW
Reviews.Content: For a pretty central position in Sydney, the price we paid was very good value. The stay for the first 4 nights had been perfect but on our last day it went wrong for 2 reasons. 1) Young drunk neighbours returned in the early hours making lots of noise so we were unable to sleep. It was like staying in a very expensive backpackers. 2) We left our bags with staff after we checked out and when we returned to the hotel for pick up to the airport, the bags were missing. The hotel had no clue where they had put them. Time for pick up was getting ever closer and they had run out of ideas. Fortunately whilst "kicking up a fuss" an elderly English lady came over and said that 2 bags similar to what she had heard us say were put on a coach outside the hotel. The staff denied this but stopped the coach leaving, bags were taken off to find our missing luggage. It was an unnecessary situation and dealt with unprofessionally. Other than the bad luck(?) of the last night I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and nice accomodations”
Reviews.Author: ericoa1
Reviews.Content: The main selling point is the location. Darling Harbour and all of its many many restaurants, bars and stores are but a few minutes walk away. A mall is a block away and China Town is right down the street. Also the mono-rail and train stations are a short (3-5 blocks) walk from the hotel. The hotel was clean and the staff was friendly and helpful. I got my money's worth and was very pleased. I'd avoid a room on the 1st floor since it's not a full sized floor. Also if you are on the street side of floors 1-2 you may have the mono-rail track run right by your window. I didn't hear any noise though.

Reviews.Title: “From Queensland Australia”
Reviews.Author: Tenterfield_Saddler
