Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights at the Holiday Inn. There was a mix-up with the room due to the booking agent giving us a twin room, but the hotel fixed this up immediately. Nice walk to Darling harbour. Convenient for the monorail, China Town and the Designer outlet stores :) at Paddy's market. Staff were pleasant and helpful at all times. The Breakfast was good! Loved the Turkey bacon. Didn't find the juice extractor annoying like a previous reviewer, but the coffee service was a bit slow at times. The gym facilities on the 3rd floor were good, and included a spa, steam room and sauna. You've got to be quick on the draw with your keycard in the lift. If not, you might end up getting there via the top floor. Try the Asian foodhalls around behind the hotel. They were great and inexpensive. Very handy for the Sydney Entertainment Centre. If you're going to a show, this is ideal accomodation. Think about an audience of 11,000 people trying to get in and out of there. We just walked across the road :) It was a better experience that trying to get a taxi from the Opera House the previous night.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: mimiandme
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights, room was a good size, we had the executive suite with seperate bedroom and huge ensuite with great ameneties(red earth) 4 towels not the usual 2 and bathrobes. Fruit daily was 2 apples so didn't get overly excited about that, room service very pricey, bottle of wine was $30 then you have room service charge and then a gratuity tax, so there are plenty of bottle of shops around where you can get wine at a 1/4 of the price. Huge tvs in living and bedroom, nice comfy beds with Duvets, we were on the elevnth floor so read tripadvisor like I did as it is well worth the effort . You just might get the monorail zooming past your window. Walking distance to the city, we got the mono rail and paid $18 for 2 on all day ticket, but really isn't necessary if you are capable of walking. Only one reall hiccup and that was that our door was left open while we were out by staff and wasn't offered any reall compensation for the stress involved, have an idea it was like that for quite a few hours, as my personal belongings and our laptop was there, although the lift has good security, have to swipe your card to go up so a bit hard if anyone else was to get in the lift. just a rude shock to come back and find it open, well worth joining the priority club ( cost nothing ) normally you would pay an extra night just for these extras. as we were able to get our room at 10 am on availability and check out was 2 pm, good when you are flying with Jetstar and their stupid flight times back to darwin, all over was a very nice stay and accidents can happen but could be costly

Reviews.Title: “Can't Go Wrong With The Holiday Inn, Darling Harbour”
Reviews.Author: Pakmoi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Darling Harbour for a week in July. We were very pleased with this hotel. The hotel is resonably priced and the rooms are comfortable and not a bad size for the price. The hotel is within walking distance of Darling Harbour and all the restaurants and shops there. It's a very enjoyable walk by fountains and palm trees with cranes perched in them. Near the hotel is The Power House Museum, a fascinating on hands museum that I highly advise seeing. Also by the hotel is the Chinese Garden. It's so beautiful and peaceful, it shoulden't be missed. They also offer a fun activity there. For ten dollars a person, Australian, you can dress in beautiful Chinese robes and the staff will take your picture with your camera. For half an hour you can walk around the garden in costume and take pictures. It's so much fun and such a different memento to take home!!! We were very happy with the staff at the hotel. They were very happy to give ideas for tour companies for day trips and to give directions when were walking in the city. They were also extremely helpful with getting us a shuttle back to the airport.The bell boys were especially friendly and helpful. Whenever they would see us in the lobby they would greet us and were very interested in what we had done that day. They gave us good advice on places to see! We loved our week in Sydney and at the Darling Harbour Holiday Inn! We can't wait till our next trip there, I wish it was tomorrow!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: DonLunsford
Reviews.Content: The Darling Harbour Holiday Inn was great It was clean, Mcdonalds across the street, tons of Asian restraunts and was within walking distance of Paddy's markerts. Get the week pass for the light rail and monorail.($28 AUD) This allows one see most everything without exhaustive walking. Also you can ride to the Cental station and take the normal subway type trains to the Circular Quay and the Rocks or anywhere in Sydney. We got a good hotel room for a very reasonable price. Internet is very expensive in Australia in general. I am use to free high speed internet included in the room price. It was a whopping 55 cents a minute at the hotel. I asked around and found you could rent high speed wireless modems from Wiredsky. This was still expensive at $90 for 7 days but beats the hotels 55 cents a minute by far. You can get on the monorail at Paddys and ride to Victoria's Market and walk to Wired Sky. We really enjoyed our stay and defintely recommend Holiday Inn Darling Harbour. Thank you, Don L. Fairfied, Ohio USA

Reviews.Title: “All round good hotel...”
Reviews.Author: MrsESE
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights in April 2006 and found it to be a convenient location, good value, clean, comfortable hotel. I would probably class the location as China town, not Darling Harbour but it's only about a 5 min walk to all the bars and restaurants of Darling Harbour and the monorail station is practically right outside to get you around the city. For the money, I would deffinately reccomend this hotel, the service was good, our safe didn't work when we arrived but they sent someone immediately to fix it. Sydney is now one of my favourite citys in the world and I would stay here again without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 day stay. Hotel is centrally located, with most major attractions within reasonable walking distance. Having the Sydney Explorer bus stop across the road was a bonus. The rooms were of a good size and were clean and the beds comfortable. We paid $171/ night including buffet breakfast for 2 people. Couple of minor crticism's, would have liked a change to the buffet breakfast selections. The only variety was they alternated daily between baked beans and spaghetti to go with the bacon,mushrooms, hash browns,tomatoes and scrambled eggs. The other annoyance was the noisy juice extractor people were using to make fresh fruit juices. We ate a couple of times in JB'S bar and grill, the food was well cooked and reasonably priced. Not many people appeared to use the main restaurant in the evenings. We would definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: mmccormi
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights upon arrival in Sydney from Canada. Got to the hotel at about 9:30 am and were given access to our room early which was lovely after a 17 flight! Good room - great shower, try and ask not to stay on the street side as the monorail starts at about 6am. Nice staff, clean room - was a good stay. Hay Market is not open Monday-Wednesday so the value of the location does decrease slightly if you are staying those days. Highly recommend the Thai massage clinic around the corner on Hay!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location in Sydney!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel looked a little old but it was recently renovated which was the primary reason I chose this place. The 3-night stay with breakfast was part of the Austrian Airline package. We had a superior room on the 4th floor just above the monorail track which for some fortunate reason did not pose as a deterrent during our stay there. The room was pretty sound proofed. But I'm impressed with its superb location just a minute walk to Chinatown with lots of shops and restaurants along George Street. The room is very clean and I must compliment the hotel housekeeping for its efficiency to be applauded with. The concierge service can be further improved. The potter just left our luggage in the lobby and did not even bother to ask if we needed baggage service up to our rooms. Another setback is the elevator service. We had to wait quite long because one elevator was down during our entire stay and the hotel was pretty packed because the elevators were always full. For these 2 reasons, I'm not giving an excellent review. But overall, we had a pleasant stay. Our visitors liked the place because they could pick and drop us off very easily without the hassle of heavy traffic as the front entrance of the hotel was located on a quieter side with very scarce traffic flow. I'd definitely recommend this hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and locatiion”
Reviews.Author: Kkelly74
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights here at the end of our trip to Australia. We were pleasantly surprised to receive a room on the top floor, which gave us a nice view of the city, and was on the side of the building so we didn't have to worry about the noise of the tram. The room was what you would expect of a Holiday Inn, with one bed, a chair, a desk, refrigerator, etc. The air conditioning would only work if you put your key in a slot near the controls, which I assume is to save energy. The room was clean and the service was good. The only complaint I had was that they are renovating the elevators and only one seemed to be working consistently. The other would stop at every floor, whether you pushed the button or not, which is not fun in an already overcrowded elevator travelling through 11 floors. It is a 5 min walk to darling harbour and the ferry, and across from a market place. We took a cab to the opera one night and it was about $13 AUD. If you want to be close to Circular Qauy and the Opera House, then you may want to look elsewhere. We generally walked from the hotel to the Quay and it took 15 to 20 mins, but was pleasant. We would certainly consider staying here again if we were fortunate enough to revisit Australia.

Reviews.Title: “Very good - Value for money”
Reviews.Author: RMJK
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the holiday inn for 3 nights and found the hotel extremely good and great value for money. Its within a 5 minute walk to the darling harbour and just 10 mins from the main shopping district - George street. Despite this, the location is very peaceful. The monorail running along the hotel is no disturbance whatsoever and infact gives a better look to the hotel. The staff were very friendly and always ready to help. The hotel staff really takes care of you as we recd a bottle of champagne the first night. This hotel is definately highly recommended and we are for sure going back the next time in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice rooms, helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: WBinBC
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel in Nov 2005 for two 5-day stretches. Paid $150 UAD per night for two people. This hotel has an excellent location--right near Darling Harbour and next to Sydney's Chinatown. Walking distance to main shopping area of downtown Sydney, and to Sydney Harbour (15 minute walk). 10 minute walk to Central Train Station. Rooms are spacious, newly-updated, and clean. Make sure you ask for a room above the 3rd floor (skytrain runs alongside the hotel). Concierge and desk staff were very helpful and pleasant. There is guest laundry and very small hottub and small gym on site. Location couldn't be better, and we felt safe walking in the area and staying at this hotel. Reservations made easily over the Holiday Inn internet site. We would definitely stay here again. A bit pricey but hotels are pricey in Sydney and often hard to get a room.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Chris044
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel 4 nights in mid December. The location is perfect; you are not more than 5 min by foot to Darling Harbour and all restaurants, and if you are not a lazy executive you can walk to circular quay. The room was really well equipped, with plenty of space, the beds were also great. We were on the 4 floor and we noticed no nuisance from the monorail. The only negative point, was two lifts were out off order during two days. I would definitely recommend the hotel and I would return there.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: artemis1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights from the 21st November and were very happy with it. We had only managed to book a smoking room but when we asked to change to non-smoking the staff were very helpful and took a lot of time to try to change our room. In the end, I think we got an upgrade as the room was pretty spacious and was on the top floor. We didn't hear any noise from the monorail but did have the airconditioning on so that may have masked the noise. The bathroom was a bit compact and the bed was far too soft, but for AUD$140 a night, we were pretty happy. The staff were very helpful. We arrived at midnight having not eaten dinner and they recommended a busy little restaurant to us in chinatown, literally a minute's walk away. As it turned out, we ate there many times during our stay, even for brekafast! It was cheap and cheerful and had excellent food, but maybe not everyone's taste of course. The staff also provided us with a universal adaptor as we had accidentally left ours in the last hotel. I'm not sure how easy it is to get to Circular Quay by public transport as we walked everywhere, but it was certainly no distance to Darling Harbour.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: Ballinora4
Reviews.Content: Very convenient location next to Darling Harbour. Very good standard bedrooms, well maintained. Room service was very good - they offer a wide range of menu items at reasonable prices - in particular they have a menu where the food is delivered quickly and in "take-away" style and with no service charge - great for kids especially. In-room Ethernet/Internet access plus public Internet access off the lobby. Very limited parking, and the nearby Entertainment Center carpark is a bit awkward to navigate to if you are new to the city. Breakfast buffet is very good - better than average, and the staff (especially in the restaurant) were exceptionally friendly. Only negative point is that the corridors (but not the bedrooms) have an odour - smells like damp.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but not great”
Reviews.Author: Jimforever
Reviews.Content: On the whole, not a bad hotel but not one I would go out of my way to stay at again. Location good - but more Chinatown than Darling Harbour. Don't expect any great views. Hotel a bit dated in places. Corridors bleak, bathroom furnishings worn. Rooms basic with small soft beds. Noise from adjacent room doors slamming was a significant problem - why can't they fit something to reduce this source of noise. Monorail audible right up to top floor where I stayed but not a nuisance. Lifts slow and housekeepinmg have an annoying habit of ringing you at 11am if you haven't vacated your room to ask if you want it serviced (or effectively to wake you up). Another annoyance was the hotel internet access, for which you can buy a card for $5. This is supposed to give you 25 mins of access, but if you use the card more than once, it debits an access charge and rounds minutes to the nearest five. In other words you get very little for your money and there are far better value Internet cafes within easy walking distance. In contrast to an otherwise mediocre stay, the reception staff I dealt with couldn't have been more helpful and are to be commended for their professionalism.

HotelInfo.Name: Holiday Inn Darling Harbour
HotelInfo.Address: 68 Harbour St, Darling Harbour, Sydney, New South Wales 2000, Australia
